elles sont tr√®s pratiques et confortables, elles tiennent tr√®s bien dans l'oreille. Je suis tr√®s surprise de leur batterie, elles tiennent 4h et leur bo√Æte de chargement tient 12h. Sono un ottimo prodotto e le consiglio a chiunque voglia delle ottime cuffie Bluetooth. La confezione contiene, oltre alle cuffie: - custodia di ricarica (le cuffie si possono caricare solo all'interno della custodia); - cavo di ricarica (micro usb); - gommini sostitutivi per le cuffie (taglia piccola e grande rispetto a quelle medie che escono di base).

Le cuffie Aukey rispecchiano perfettamente la descrizione ed il pacco √® arrivato in anticipo di una settimana. Pi√π nel dettaglio: -Le cuffie Wireless sono maneggevoli, piccole, discrete e touch (non hanno pulsanti). -Arrivano in un pacchetto contenente un libretto di istruzione in 5 lingue diverse; una "Quick start guide"; Garanzia di 24 mesi; 3 paia di gommini di diverse dimensioni ( S, M, L) per adattarsi meglio al padiglione auricolare e non cadono facendo esercizio fisico; cavetto per ricaricare con uscita USB. -Sono semplicissime da usare: √® necessario accendere il Bluetooth dello smartphone (o altro dispositivo), fare la ricerca e collegare gli auricolari. Questi si accendono con un tocco leggero per due secondi. -Il case (la custodia) si ricarica completamente in 2h e permette di caricare le cuffie circa 4 - 5 volte. -Inoltre, io ho uno smartphone Xiaomi e sono compatibili nonostante non sia scritto in descrizione. Le recensisco dopo una settimana di utilizzo e le trovo molto comode, sia per ascoltare musica in quell'ora di esercizi casalinghi per tenersi in forma in questo periodo, sia nel parlare al telefono. Nel consueto pacchetto/scatolina Aukey marrone troviamo il case elegantissimo che a primo impatto sembra fatto di pelle nera, con all'interno i due auricolari marchiati Aukey, il cavetto per ricaricare, 3 paia di gommini per tutte le tipologie di orecchie e l'immancabile libretto di istruzioni. Come gi√† detto sono molto comode e durevoli in pi√π il suono esce limpido e potente e le conversazioni non risentono dei consueti fruscii che altre tipologie di auricolari hanno. Dopo il primo accoppiamento in cui come sempre dobbiamo effettuare la ricerca tramite bluetooth del nostro smartphone, le cuffie, ai successivi utilizzi, andranno a ricercare in automatico il nostro telefono e si collegheranno in semplicit√†. Solo 2 consigli, per chi decide di acquistarle: 1. bisogna sistemarle bene nell'orecchio, pena una perdita drammatica delle frequenze basse (errore che io ho fatto nei primi giorni di utilizzo, durante i quali mi sembravano suonare malissimo e "stridenti") 2. necessitano di qualche giorno di rodaggio, prima di esprimersi al meglio (io ho notato dei miglioramenti dopo circa 1 settimana di utilizzo). Importante per tutti noi √® che questi ottimi auricolari bluetooth sono venduti su Amazon, pertanto godono di tutta la garanzia verso il cliente, che da sempre contraddistingue Amazon, mi sento pienamente fiducioso di consigliarne l‚Äôacquisto.

L'autonomie est donc parfaitement plus que suffisante. üìÑBilan : Produit qui correspond largement √† mes attentes, confortables, bon son et tr√®s bonne autonomie.

These are some strange ones. I am hesitating between 4 and 5 stars, and when I started playing with these I initially thought that I'd give them only 3 stars as I immediately noticed a few issues (I have owned some 7-8 pairs of this type of headsets). But after testing them thoroughly and comparing sound quality with my other headsets, I concluded that they have a few superior features, mainly sound quality and comfort, that warrant 5 stars in spite of a few issues. So the sound quality is the best out of all my headsets, including some that are 50% more expensive now. They have a boomy bass (maybe even too boomy), but that can be reduced by slightly moving the earbud backwards (turning it in the ear, if you know what I mean). The higher frequencies are very pleasing and offer good reproduction of the sound. These headphones handled best one song that seemed to overpower other headphones with its loud sounds - these still sounded ok and pleasing. The volume is also quite high, so it's very satisfying. They are also very fast in connecting and disconnecting, however, there is this annoying design issue. When you place them back in the box, they immediately stop playing, but the phone thinks they are still playing and keeps sending them the stream, and they will not switch off until I close the box. This is annoying as an extra step to do. Also, I don't want them to connect to my phone and hijack the audio stream every time and open the box just to look at them - and they are really fast in connecting - only 2 seconds, so it's a world record almost - really fast. If only they did it only when I remove them from the box... Another thing is the cup - the medium size was too small for me, so I needed to use the largest size to enjoy the full sound quality, so someone with large ears has no recourse here. They sit well in the ears and are difficult to shake off with the hooks around the ears, however, to get the best sound quality I can only hook them a little bit - and further twist/turn to put them more behind the ears and all sound quality goes to ... somewhere else. Here are the pros: - great sound quality - great handling of loud sounds - super fast connecting and disconnecting - USB C (finally someone has done it!) - nice looking and soft touch case/box - two colours of ear hooks (I really like the bright green) - very comfortable if fitted properly in the right position - secure fit with comfortable soft hooks - internal volume control by holding the side buttons Cons: - buttons too hard to press (maybe they will wear in and become softer with time) - an annoying feature of switching on upon just opening the box - an annoying feature of not switching off until the box is closed - good sound quality only when hooks are hooked just a little bit over ears, so it's not super secure (but still quite secure - very difficult to shake them off) - the largest cup is actually medium, so most people will need to change and no recurse for people with large ear canals So all in all great sounding headphones with internal volume control and comfortable hooks, but annoying feature of connecting upon opening the box. Some people will be super happy with them while other super annoyed.

Where have these headphones been all my life? - I am a retired musician so i'm very very fussy about my music and how I listen to it, my current pair are quite good quality but the left ear bud keeps falling out no matter how I try to keep it in, I've tried different sizes of the small ear pieces that fit on but to no avail. I was looking to buy a new pair and came across these beauties! - the quality of the playback is exceptional, just enough bass and treble etc, they fit around my ears perfectly so will not keep falling out, even though my wife and I wear glasses they are still very comfortable to wear (See pictures) Very easy to use, simply turn on your bluetooth, look for G4 and you're up and running, couldn't be easier! I'm actually over the moon with these, I listen to virtually everything through headphones, I believe you get the best from your music by doing this so I'm very happy indeed with my purchase, worth every penny in my opinion! 5 Stars all the way! *****

Have yet to take them to the gym (the reason why I purchased them in the first place) but so far this is my impression: Fit - they fit very well with the rubber ear hooks not interfering with my glasses and the default medium size rubber ear-canal caps appear to be a perfect fit, sealing off the outside pretty well (this is the noise cancelation it talks of in the description). Make sure you try all three sizes when you get them because they have a significant effect on sound quality. The key is to make sure they seal the ear canal completely and then the quality really shines. They seem to be comfortable and shouldn't budge even under vigorous exercise to a point where they can be tricky to remove again. They also came with a neon yellow pair of ear hooks too. Sound quality - So far pretty decent, particularly for the price. They are bass heavy without distortion but it can overwhelm the mids however this seems to improved slightly after running them for about 20mins so it might improve once they wear in. They have a solid high end that doesn't sound tinny and overall deliver quite a wide sound stage. Deadmau5 "Some Chords" builds nicely and the bass kick can almost be felt. ELO's Living Thing on the other hand is a little disappointing, lacking sharpness in the drums but the vocals sit nicely and the instrument placement is good. Santana's "oye Como Va" shines, almost sounding like surround sound with the instruments and effects placed around the room. Bluetooth audio codecs appear to be limited to AAC (default) and SBC on my Note 9. Interface - Pretty simple physical rubberized buttons on each that take a fair push to click but work as advertised (single click to pause / play, double click (not overly sensitive how fast you click) to skip with the left ear clicking back and the right ear forward. Holding the button slowly turns the volume up (right ear) and down (left ear). Triple click launches your default voice assistant. Pairing - Easy to set up on my Note 9. Launch the bluetooth setting and hit scan open the lid of the case and wait a few seconds for "G4" to appear then just click pair and that is it. Supports HFP, HSP, A2DP and AVRCP. After use put the headphones back into the case (the snap in place with a satisfying action due to the magnetic restraint holding them in place) and close the lid. The next time just open the lid, and about 2secs later they are paired up and working. The Case itself is small and light with a rubberised texture and USB-C charging port (small cable included).

Love these headphones so much. They look far more expensive than they are. They are a very good quality set. They have the normal earbud sections that fit into your ear canal but also an ear hook that fits around your ears for extra security and grip. They are very very comfortable to wear and come with a spare set of the ear hooks. They really do cancel out the background noise as far as I‚Äôm concerned and are so easy to operate. The sound quality is superb as far as I‚Äôm concerned. They play for about 5hours from a full charge. The case when it‚Äôs fully charged can charge them up just over 4 times. They come with a charging cable as standard. The case is a neat smooth case with a dull finish. Very aesthetically pleasing to the eyes. They put quickly and are definitely ones I‚Äôd recommend. I love them and they don‚Äôt cost the earth.

My wife's reaction when I received them: not another pair!ü§£ü§£ü§£ü§£ I found these very appealing because of the ear hooks and also because of the price. I found alternative earbuds with hooks but they did not look as nice and their box was really prismatic. These have a nice shape and do not take over the whole side of your face. They are still quite discreet. In addition, the shadow of the charging box is just yummy ü§ó. The box does not take long to charge with the USB C cable, plus you can use a fast charger. Most importantly, they are comfortable, secure and the sound is awesome. I went to Chester earlier and on the way back to the car, I listened to some music. The sound was great and I could not hear the sound of buses, cars and vans rushing mere inches off me! The noise isolation is great I love them and just keep getting amazed by how great value technology is nowadays.

I bought these earbuds in one of amazons flashdeals when the comparative HolyHigh earbuds I initially plumped for arrived faulty (only one earbud worked) As such, I can provide a rudimentary comparison between the two brands for those it might be useful to. Frankly, the holyhighs I preferred aesthetically. The charger box seemed a little smaller, the earbuds packed more neatly together, and the earhooks were thicker and appeared less flimsey than these slimmer more flexible ones. I like 'sturdy!'. HOWEVER. The HolyHighs arrived faulty while the Muzili's arrived in perfect condition and bluetoothed to my mobile effortlessly. Initially they sounded a little bass heavy, but going into my mobile music settings and turning to 'reduced bass' (duh!) fixed the worst of the issue and they sound much better for my musical tastes (mostly classical, some pop/classic rock) now. I am not a techie, and was pretty surprised by how much the in-phone EQ settings did change the music, so for anyone not immediately thrilled with the sound, definitely give these settings a looksie before dismissing them. I also initially found the earbuds not especially comfortable and they made my inner ears somewhat 'tickly'. Switching to the smallest spare earbud covers did the trick for me. Noise cancellation is pretty decent. When 'he' listens to his godawful music on the hi-fi I can listen to my earbuds in the same room without hearing any jumble of sound. Which is nice. Its difficult to give an accurate sound comparison against the holyhighs, because of course I only had the one ear to listen through on them, but the sound appeared somewhat comparative. So negligible in my layman opinion as to not be a deciding factor either way. The earbud controls on the Muzili's felt much easier and more responsive than on the holyhighs. Thats handy, particularly for turning on and off on those many occasions when someone ('he' again) interrupts your music just for the sake of making their own voice heard. If the literature is anything to go by these earbuds take the lead in that they offer notably more listening time per charge. I have yet to explore this to its fullest but can confirm that I got 3 days intermittent use from them on a single charge with no signs of needing to charge imminently. Between rooms and floors (one floor) bluetooth does not provide much of an issue (a momentary cut-out of sound occasionally when you close the door between device and earphones but for me it has come back after that temperamental 'blip') but leaving the device inside while you go outside is a complete dealbreaker. I imagine this is common for all bluetooth devices of this budget, but I dont know from actual experience. This isnt a problem for me personally though, since I am never far away from my phone anyway. I'm just bored of getting tangled up in its wires. All in all, a very useful, uber portable little item for housework and blocking out the world. I bought them in a flash deal for around ¬£31. They currently retail on amazon at around ¬£38. I would be happy to pay either price for their functionality and would vote they ultimately trump the currently price comparative holyhighs for the more responsive operation buttons on the earbuds.

I've owned numerous earphones/headphones over the years and consider myself a bit of an audiophile. And while I'm by no means a professional, I'd like to think my experience counts for something. I already own a pair of working bluetooth earphones, but the skip track controls gave up the ghost, which is quite crucial for someone that cycles with their phone in their backpack and thus I felt an upgrade was due, so I bought these. And on first impressions these are actually very good by comparison. They're a bit more expensive than my previous pair, but I feel like the price increase was justified given what I'm getting in return. Out the box, you can tell that they haven't skipped out on materials. While the charge case is made of plastic, it by no means feels like it's going to fall apart the moment you accidentally breathe on it. Battery charge LEDs can be found on the front of the box and a USB Type C socket can be found at the rear, which is a god send if you love standardisation and hate the usual micro USB. The lid is hinged at one end and held in place with magnets at the opposing end, giving it a secure and solid feel when closed. Upon opening the case I was greeted with a very quiet "power on". And honestly I got a lot more excited about that than I should have done. It's a simple but very nice touch , meaning once paired to your phone (which was a pretty easy process), it's literally a case of whipping them out the case and slapping them in your ears without having to faff around with power switches. By contrast my last pair sometimes got possessed and would power off in the on position (they also seem to power off automatically after a few seconds when you put them back in the case). Speaking of slapping them in your ears, they're a very comfortable fit and they certainly don't feel like they're going to fall out. You could probably do a face first front flip over your handlebars, slide along the road for a bit and these things would still be playing graceful orchestral music in your ears throughout the duration... Unlike my last pair which ditched me the minute I left the ground. The buttons for play/pause, skip, etc. are nicely placed and have some nice feedback to them too. Everyone likes a good clicky button and they will satisfy that part of you. One thing to note is that these aren't capacitive touch control. A feature I specifically looked for because capacitive touch control in the rain with wet hands is generally, in my experience, abysmal to work with. Obviously, they come with large and small buds (on top of the preinstalled medium ones) which is to be expected, as well as a fluorescent green hooks in the event you don't like the preinstalled black ones. Again, a nice touch. Sound quality-wise, I honestly don't think you're going to do much better than these for the price range. And while they definitely won't replace my over-ear headphones, they do trump them in that I sadly can't wear my headphones with my bike helmet. I mean... I haven't tried, but I'm not sure I want to give off the cyberpunk teletubby vibe. Moving on, I listen to a lot of 80's rock, hair/glam Metal, the likes of Bon Jovi, Def Leppard, Motley Crue, etc. Because despite being in my early 20's I actually know what good music sounds like. The bass response is great for the form factor and the mid tones are just right for me. The treble is a bit on the sharp side for my personal taste (which is to be expected), but nothing a bit of EQ can't fix. Great sound for the form factor. Overall, I'm pleasantly surprised by these and I imagine you will be too.

I purchased these for my husband for Christmas they arrived promptly my husband was very impressed with these earbuds the build quality is excellent. They look and feel very durable my husband said that they are very comfortable within the ear and over the back of the ear the sound quality is good very crisp and clear. Setting up was easy the supplied instructions were easy to follow I bought these so he could use his tablet without me having to hear what he is watching. They certainly did the job he has also used them with his phone and he has been very impressed the quality of sound there is no echoing through them. The battery life is good better than other ones we have had in the past so far we have been very impressed with these and based on our experiences we would definitely recommend them.

The MOST comfortable sports Bluetooth earphones I have ever tried so far? Yup! That's right! I truly didn't think that a pair can get so comfortable in your ear until I got those. The first impression I had when I wore them first was "I can barely feel it!" - It is so light and the rubber hook doesn't cause any discomfort around my ears no matter how long I wear them. These are not my first sports pair but surely the best design so far. The earphones come so nicely packed in an elegant box with accessories, USB C cable and a charging base/power bank. Sound quality is really good. The sound is so clear! Also, the Bluetooth connects super fast as soon as the charging base lid. Used it for several hours without needing to charge it at all! Loving this choice and so happy with my purchase!

So I purchased this pair of earphones as I wanted something which was wireless as well as secure around the ear. These Headphones are solid, I‚Äôve been using them for mainly exercise and my commute from home to work and back home again. They last for a long time without having to charge them, the sound quality is good and they stay in your ear when pushing weights and on the treadmill. They look discreet and not too in your face like most Bluetooth headphones. I think one of the nicest features is the box which charges the headphones whilst your on the move. Also it is magnetic and holds the headphones in place. They connect quickly without too much faffing with the Bluetooth setting, very easy to pair with your phone. You can also use just one earphone and you don‚Äôt have to use both of them at the same time. Solid set of headphones! 5 Stars!

There isn't much to dislike about the Muzili Wireless Headphones. I've tried a number of wireless earphones over the last two years on Amazon and these are up at the top. The battery life was the big sell for me- on one charge I'm getting more than 5 hours of play out of them, on android, while running and at the gym, and the short charge time (less than 2 hours) is worth some praise. Comfort is also pretty good- usually the tips on earbuds are the part where things get uncomfortable but these are snug and the overear hooks don't get annoying after long periods of wear, so comfort is great overall. The only minor negative I can find is the lack of bass and while the treble is fantastic and the sound even in voice is great, the bass does lack sometimes on my deeper songs.

Definitely one of the best headphones I have had in the recent past. Headphones are really great. I like the fact that these headphones have all features of basic Bluetooth headphones and in addition to basic features what stands out is the sound quality and its design to ensure they wont falls during the exercise such as running. Its really easy to connect to smartphones and once connected that's it.. It auto connects every time I switched it on while trying it. Sound quality is amazing. Best part is the charging box which stores certain amount of battery power and charges the wireless headphones when I kept them back in to box.Love the design, sound quality and the user friendliness of this headphone. Highly recommended üëç

Every now and again I try to buy a pair of headphones that are most suitable for wearing when running. I was attracted to this set as there are no cables (other than the charging lead) involved. The phones are worn within the ear and hook around the 'shell like' with a rubber leg. I have found them comfortable to wear (having done so for 3 x 5 km runs to date). They do not delve too deeply into the ear canal and have not caused any discomfort either inside or around the outside of my lugs. They are quite light and do not pull down on my ears at all. The decibel level is satisfactory for me, in that it provides a good level of sound while still allowing me to hear surrounding noises, albeit muted. I found these earphone easy to use, to sync with my iPhone, and to charge via the dinky carry/protective casing. All in all, so far, I am happy with my purchase.

Uno spettacolo!!! Aukey non mi delude mai. Le mie belle airpods hanno fatto un giro in lavatrice e ho dovuto trovare un degno sostituto perch√© lavorando in ufficio non posso fare a meno di avere sempre cuffie nelle orecchie per ascoltare musica e rispondere alle mille chiamate. Non avendo nessuna intenzione di ricomprare le airpods visto il loro costo, ho iniziato ad acquistare svariati modelli di cuffie bluetooth economiche ( Xiaomi Redmi AirDots[restituite perch√© non si associavano con il MacBook], Yobola[restituite perch√© facevano interferenza con le cuffie del mio collega di scrivania ed erano abbastanza brutte], Muzili VV1[bassi completamente assenti, regalate a mio fratello] ) fino ad arrivare per caso a queste quasi scoraggiato. ************ Sono super soddisfatto dell'acquisto. Qualit√† sonora che eguaglia le AirPods finalmente. Finalmente delle cuffie economiche con bassi decenti e un suono non tendente agli alti. In chiamata sono chiare e l'interlocutore riceve un segnale pulito(mi hanno anche detto che la vengono abbastanza filtrati i rumori ambientali dell'ufficio). La connessione tra cuffie e devices √® ottima: si sono connesse in maniera lampo sia al mio Galaxy S10 che al mio MacBook. Qualit√† costruttiva ottima, non sembrano per niente delle cuffie economiche. I comandi touch sono reattivi come quelli delle AirPods quindi avrete sempre il controllo di tutto, dalle chiamate alla musica. Il case √® piccolo e discreto: il pi√π piccolo provato finora, sta benissimo in tasca(unico neo lo sportellino ha una cerniera leggerissima che a fatica rimane aperta). Per il prezzo pagato sono un vero best buy per chi cerca delle cuffie senza fili in-ear con una qualit√† sonora ottima sia per la musica che per le chiamate. P.S.: L'unica cosa che Devo ancora testare √® la durata della batteria che provveder√≤ ad aggiornare a breve

A dire il vero, preciso di avere un paio di cuffie Bose, come cuffie principali. Tuttavia, ho constatato che in estate sono calde, fanno sudare e sono piuttosto grandi da portare con s√© durante i viaggi. Cos√¨ ho pensato di cercare delle cuffie facilmente trasportabili e meno ingombranti. Non volevo spendere circa ‚Ç¨ 150 per una coppia di auricolari AirPods della Apple, quindi ho fatto una ricerca e ho trovato questi auricolari. E, a dire il vero, li adoro! Li uso gi√† da un paio di settimane e sono ancora nella fase ‚Äúsei l‚Äôamore della mia vita‚Äù; in ogni caso, cercher√≤ di essere il pi√π obiettivo possibile. [Qualit√† del suono] Bassi potenti e acuti chiari e cristallini. Quando sono inseriti correttamente, questi auricolari stupiscono per la potenza e qualit√† dei suoni bassi. Per questo consiglio di prestare particolare attenzione nello scegliere i cuscinetti in silicone che si adattano comodamente al proprio canale uditivo, senza lasciare spazi vuoti all‚Äôinterno dell‚Äôorecchio. [Comodit√†] Nella confezione ci sono cuscinetti auricolari in silicone di 3 dimensioni, quindi sicuramente si potr√† scegliere quella che pi√π si adatta alle proprie esigenze. Come ho gi√† detto, bisogna scegliere quelli pi√π comodi e che non lasciano spazi vuoti nelle orecchie in modo da ottenere una migliore qualit√† del suono. [Isolamento acustico] Fantastico! Li ho usati anche in aereo e faticavo a rendermi conto di essere in volo. Quando li uso in ufficio, le persone spesso devono agitare le mani per attirare la mia attenzione, perch√© non sento altro se non la mia musica (con il volume al 70%). [Durata della batteria] Usandoli da 10 giorni, per un‚Äôora al giorno circa, questa √® la prima volta che devo ricaricare la base. Posso quindi dire che la durata totale della batteria, compresa la carica completa della base, √® di circa 10 ore. [Altre note] L'operazione di associazione (pairing) √® davvero semplice. Ho notato che anche se li spengo e li conservo nella custodia, dopo un po‚Äô si riconnettono al mio iPhone. Ho dovuto quindi ‚Äúdisconnettere‚Äù gli auricolari, entrando nelle impostazioni di iPhone, per spegnerli completamente. Ora devo collegarli manualmente all'iPhone ogni volta che li uso. Ma questo non √® un grosso problema. [Conclusioni] Non c‚Äô√® da pagare ‚Ç¨ 150 per gli AirPods. S√¨, certamente possono essere pi√π fantasiosi, sembrano pi√π belli e sono connessi a Siri, ma sinceramente non credo che tutto questo possa giustificare la differenza di prezzo. Sono innamorato di questi auricolari e ad oggi ne sono ancora innamorato.

I was looking for a replacement of my Zolo Liberty as they were chunky and battery started to die quickly, therefore i've been looking around to understand what's the best budget earbuds with touch controls, good sound quality and good portability. I then selected 3 main earbuds: Haylou GT1 (30¬£) Aukey EPT-16S (50¬£) Aukey EPT-21S (30¬£) - this item There are so many more earbuds like Taotrinics, Urbanista, Soundcore , etc but after checking their reviews or youtube videos i saw that all of them had some issues with touch controls, audio latency when watching netflix or youtube, connection drops or price higher than my budget (50¬£). So among those 3 i decided to get the Aukey EPT-21S , as this model should provide better microphone quality in calls compared to the other 2. It also have a very small case almost similar to the Apple airpods case that is the big winner today. ( i was looking to someting that can easily fit in your jeans pocket and it's not heavy, that's why Aukey EPT-21S does a good job). Materials: earbuds and case are made of plastic , they are available both in white or matte black , i chose the matte black one and it's really well made. Both the case and the earbuds do not show your fingerprint. The arbuds are a bit thicker compared to the airpods but they are in black color so they are not like a hit in the eye when you are wearing them ; still the design is good enough but not as great as Airpods (they are a bit thick) Aukey also provides eartips for all sizes (Small/Medium/Large) . I grabbed the medium ones and honestly the earbuds fit really well and you can barely feeling them. The case is really small, very well made, as said almost same size of the Apple airpods , it's probably 2 cm longer and 1 cm thicker but still fits easily in your jeans . Sound and Mic quality: I've tried the earbuds using spotify and they sound really good , good bass, good trebles , being budget earbuds the sound is quite good. If you are an audiophile you would probably go for something higher end like sony or Apple airpods Pro, but the target of these earbuds is people going to gym, running, or using them during their daily commute in the tube or train and i think they will be satisfied. The phone calls are quite good too , people on the other side can hear quite well especially in non-noisy environments . If you are outside the microphones will not cancel the noise so whoever is on call with you will hear it. Touch controls: really working well, it recognise properly when you touch to control your music or summon your Siri or Google assistant. I would say the rate of success is around 85% . double tap : stop or play music (works for both earbuds) Hold on for 2 secs: next song (right earbud) or previous song (left earbud) triple tap: google assistant or Siri summoning hold 10 secs both earbuds together: Clear the bluetooth connection Audio latency: this is something i've been testing using both Apple ipad , iphone and android phone (Google pixel 3). I wanted to make sure that watching Netflix or Youtube videos there was no latency issue and Aukey made it! Test passed! Battery: Aukey says earbuds should last 5 hours before the next charge. The case provides 4 more charges , for a total play time of 25 hours. I didn't have a chance to test this yet as i've just received them. Few issues: having them connected to a macbook , couple of times they were losing connection for 1 sec and then restore it, not a big deal but it was unexpected. If you connect Aukey earbuds to the android phone and you want tor record a video , you cannot record the audio using the microphone of the earbuds. The phone will still use the microphone of your phone. if you are running and wearing a hat across your ears and earbuds, well if the hat is sweat you might see your songs being changed or your earbuds being disconnected because the touch control is really sensible. Conclusion: If you are looking for budget earbuds with Bluetooth 5, touch controls and good sound quality then go for these ones. You won't regret it. Sound quality is good, case is small and portable, earbuds in matte dark color are quite nice and the battery last long. I think these are the best for this price range (30-60 ¬£) Hope this review helps !

Nelle immagini allegate alla recensione ho proposto un confronto con altri prodotti similari del genere TWS. Una brevissima premessa: questa tipologia di cuffie, a mio avviso, devono avere delle caratteristiche di semplicit√†, di immediatezza e di praticit√† che le rendano adatte ad un uso quotidiano. L‚Äôascolto della musica √® una componente non irrilevante (ho usato brani tutti in mp3 a 320 kbps e spotify, generi vari in particolar modo jazz, funk, stoner rock), ma deve essere bilanciato dal fatto che devono essere usate per le chiamate, riposte facilmente nel case e non ingombranti. Queste Aukey ept21 sono eccellenti ad un prezzo davvero straordinario, non credo si possa trovare di meglio e per di pi√π le ritengo perfettamente adatte all'uso tipico di questi auricolari. Nel cos√¨ detto mixed usage sono le migliori. Vediamo nel particolare: Comodit√†: Sono delle in ear, ma estremamente comode. Aderiscono bene all'orecchio, estremamente leggere. Altrettanto comodo il trasporto del case. L'isolamento √® passivo, ma sufficiente ad effettuare delle chiamate comode. Qualit√† chiamate e microfoni: Le MIGLIORI in assoluto. E questo il punto che fa la differenza con tutte le altre tipologie. Sento perfettamente l'interlocutore e sopratutto l'interlocutore non ha MAI (e dico MAI), manifestato problemi a differenza delle gran parte delle cuffie tws. Se si utilizzano questo tipo di cuffie questo elemento √® essenziale e, davvero, su non hanno rivali anche con riferimento ad altri auricolari che costano molto di pi√π. Qualit√† suono: Il suono √® assolutamente accettabile: alti e medi e sono ben definiti e bilanciati, i bassi un pizzico sotto tono (non sono un fan dei bassi, ma se fossero un po' pi√π presenti darebbero maggiore rotondit√† e spessore all‚Äôaudio). Certamente la qualit√† audio non √® il loro punto di forza, ma l'ascolto della musica rimane comunque piacevole. Una piccola precisazione: per coloro che fanno delle questioni di religione circa l'accuratezza del suono, dico che se si vuole un ascolto importante √® stupido comprare le tws perch√© nessuna pu√≤ restituire l'importanza di un ascolto paragonabile a delle cuffie specificatamente dedicate come delle around ear o a delle in ear monitor "serie" (credetemi ho diverse cuffie in tal senso dei marchi pi√π affidabili AKG, Bose, Sennheiser, Shure). Per cui mi sembra sciocco parlare tout court della qualit√† del suono in questa tipologia di cuffie (considerando che spesso si ascolta la musica su Spotify o con mp3 a 128 kbps). La domanda √® questa: l'ascolto √® piacevole √® coinvolgente con queste cuffie? S√¨, vanno bene. C'√® di meglio? S√¨ ma non vale la pena spendere 3, 4, 5 volte tanto... Compratevi delle around ear serie, una dac ed ascoltate brani in flac o almeno con campionamenti adeguati. Connessione: Perfetta, rapida, si collegano anche singolarmente. Non ho notato alcun problema di perdita del segnale. Rapporto qualit√† prezzo: eccezionale, ripeto non si pu√≤ trovare di meglio. I comandi funzionano discretamente, ma presa la mano il touch non √® un problema. Tutte in plastica (mi piace il nero satinato) che sembra un po' cheap, ma super leggere e all'apparenza solide. Straconsigliate! ZOLO liberty plus Prese su Kickstarter nella versione Backer edition Comodit√†: Sono molto comodi gli auricolari (forniti da un corredo impressionante di gommini) anche se sporgono dall‚Äôorecchio un po‚Äô. Un isolamento passivo PAZZESCO, davvero strabiliante, tanto da essere necessario, se si va in giro, la funzione trasparency. Molto, molto ingombrante e pesante il case. Qualit√† chiamate e microfoni: Funziona solo un auricolare (il destro, per me non √® un problema). Sufficiente al chiuso, appena sufficiente all‚Äôaperto. Rispetto ad altre cuffie del genere non si comportano in maniera eccessivamente malvagia. Qualit√† suono: Straordinario e ripeto, straordinario. Le migliori del lotto e, credetemi, decisamente superiori a moltissime altre cuffie ben pi√π costose (stile Bose sport, Samsung ed anni luce superiori alle Airpods 1a ver, le nuove non le ho provate). Driver in graphene, suono estremamente defintito e dettagliato. Un po' ridondanti i bassi ma comuque precisi. Connessione: Mediocre: 12 sec per la connessione da spente ed a volte, nonostante il BT 5.0, si perde il segnale. Rapporto qualit√† prezzo: adesso si trovano ad 80 euro su Amazon, prodotto un po' datato. Case in alluminio e finiture eccellenti. Bomaker SiFi Comodit√†: Estremamente piccole, leggere e comodissime. Decisamente le migliori del lotto su questo versante. La plastica √® fatta molto, molto bene, piacevolissimo il case. Comandi funzionali. Qualit√† chiamate e microfoni: PESSIMA. Non so se √® un problema mio, ma praticamente inutilizzabili, l'interlocutore ha problemi enormi a sentirci. Qualit√† suono: Suonano bene, devo dire che mi hanno sorpreso. Bilanciate. Ascolto piacevolissimo. Connessione: Rapida e stabile. I punti di forza risiedono nella estrema leggerezza: case ed auricolari sono incredibilmente comodi, nel suono e nei comandi (non sono touch) perfetti e si controlla anche il volume. Ma la questione delle chiamate a mio avviso le pregiudica molto. Rapporto qualit√† prezzo: Personalmente, (anche se molti si sono trovati bene), devo sconsigliarne l‚Äôacquisto: il problema delle chiamate √® davvero eccessivo. Anche in ambienti chiusi i loro microfoni sono insufficienti. Peccato. TWS880 (Moosen) Comodit√†: Comode, ma sporgono un tantino. Case, a mio avviso, un po' troppo ingombrante. I comandi touch, non mi hanno fatto impazzire (si controlla anche il volume), anzi creano qualche problema (ma posso essere io il problema). Qualit√† chiamate e microfoni: Non sono rimato entusiasta, ma dopo le AUKEY sonoi le migliori Qualit√† suono: Vi piacciono i bassi? Se s√¨ fanno al caso vostro. A parte lo scherzo, il suono √® assolutamente piacevole e bilanciato, volume bello alto, mi sono piaciute. Connessione: Rapida e discretamente stabile (qualche piccola incertezza a volte, ma nulla di drammatico). Rapporto qualit√† prezzo: L'apparenza √® molto cheap nelle plastiche ed insieme all‚Äôessere ingombranti ed ai comandi touch un po‚Äô incerti mi rendono perplesso nel consigliarne l‚Äôacquisto. Il loro riposizionamento sul case non √® poi dei migliori. La qualit√† dell‚Äôaudio √® sicuramente valida, comode e leggere‚Ä¶ ma ho qualche perplessit√† nel loro uso complessivo (mixed usage). CONCLUSIONE: Perch√© consiglio queste AUKEY: E' un marchio serio con prodotti curati e sopratutto affidabili. Ed il bilanciamento fra tutte le voci, a mio avviso le rende la scelta migliore. La qualit√† delle chiamate, ripeto, al top (ed √® fondamentale per questa tipologia di cuffie). Ascolto della musica, sebbene non sia il loro punto di forza, √® decisamente godibile e piacevole. Qualit√† costruttiva: il case √® leggerissimo e comodo, le cuffie hanno una plastica satinata solida e piacevole. Prezzo sconvolgente. Andate sul sicuro non ve ne pentirete. Spero di esservi stato utile.

Ho preso queste cuffie un po‚Äô scettico ü§® nella loro riuscita. Ho le AirPods, spettacolari ma, spesso mi danno problemi per il collegamento con il PC. Queste le uso in ufficio per sentire la musica e per Skype. La mia recensione parte da qui e sar√† confronto con le AirPods di prima generazione! - Volume molto buono, identico a quello delle AirPods ma essendo in ear si continuano a sentire se usate in luoghi rumorosi (metro o tram). - Dimensioni contenute, pochissimo pi√π grandi delle cuffie Apple - Essendo in ear le gesture sono un po‚Äô scomode, quando si fa il doppio tap per rispondere o per mettere in pausa, si sente il gommino che urta alle pareti a cui aderisce. - Il suono √® leggermente pi√π piatto rispetto alle AirPods, mi sarei aspettato una bella differenza vendendo la differenza di prezzo, invece sono molto soddisfatto dalla qualit√†. Con il volume al massimo la cosa √® un po‚Äô pi√π marcata ma nulla di grave! - Mi si sono scollegate dallo smartphone qualche volta facendo continuare la musica a tutto volume - Con i gommini taglia M quando cammino per strada rimbomba tutto nelle orecchie, non sono abituato ad essere isolato dal contesto. - Volume durante la chiamata molto buono; qualche interlocutore ha detto di sentirmi con voce robotica ed ho notato che capita quando si √® in zone dove c‚Äô√® davvero poca linea.

Sound is strong and is aligned to the price tag. These are definitely providing a good sound quality and experience, and quite possibly punch a little above their weight. For a comparison I used to us CX 300ii headphones. I'd put these in the same category. Decent bass (see below on creating a good seal), reasonably clear mids and highs that do the job. It's the highs that are the weakest point here. When listening to orchestral music with crowded highs, there is a tendency for things to get a mixed up, which doesn't happen for similar music that is low or mid heavy. Either way, they are delivering a perfectly acceptable listening experience at a fraction of the price of a premium brand. Fit is great. I have HUGE ear canals and always go to the largest silicone tips. In this case the large tips were a little small still, but I took the large tips from another pair of broken buds and they are working exceptionally well. As with other similar designs, the seal of the silicone tips make a huge difference to the listening experience and ambient sound isolation, and its worth trying them out to make sure you get a good fit. The real reason I got these was in the hope that the silicone tips would provide a more secure physical fit as I wanted to run in them. I'm pleased to say that after my first (slow) 10k with them they stayed put, kept their bluetooth, synced perfectly well with each other and my Apple Watch, and it was pretty easy to forget you were wearing them. Perfect for what I need. It's a little early to talk on battery life but after a few hours of listening they are still going strong. Features are pretty good for the price. The touch controls for play/pause/next/prev do the job but I have found that I need to train my fingers a little. I have a pair of Sony 1000XM2's and I struggle with their touch controls a bit too, so it might be more user error... All in all a decent punt.

I have purchased other wireless earphones/buds in the past; unfortunately, with the other brands, they never work effectively. I wanted to have the same experience as with Apple Airpods where they connect instantly and the sound quality and mic is perfect. All these features for this price is a bargain! To add, these are very light and comfortable and you can see from the images, these are the same size as Airpods. I highly recommend to anyone!

Received these for my son this week. I have had to prise them from him just to take a photo for you all to see because these are fab. Luckily it‚Äôs nearly Christmas :) So in case you hadn‚Äôt realised, they are brilliant, appealing with all ages, easy to use. Thank you.

Il suono √® di qualit√† e non distorce: Bassi potenti e alti chiari e cristallini. Gli auricolari hanno funzioni attivabili con il touch (sia il sinistro che il destro). Infatti potremo rispondere/rifiutare ad una chiamata, mentre nell' ascolto di musica passare tra una canzone e l'altra, abbassare/alzare il volume, compatibili quindi con le app di musica online come amazon music. These Bluetooth earphones are simply the best value for money I have found. They have good sound quality, easily good enough for me and my needs (phone calls, YouTube videos, pod casts, and some music), and probably be great for most people outside of the music or video/ film industry. The Aukey headphones come with ea charging case, which extends the battery life to ~25 hours, but I normally just charge the case once every couple of weeks, to ensure they keep going. They have a microphone in each ear piece, to make phone calls sound good, and very easy to pair and just use. The usability is great, open the case and insert a ear piece into the ear, and they will connect in about that time. I have the Anker Soundcore Life P2, which are an equivalent to these in terms of price and functionality. the Anker are a little more expense (about ¬£5 to ¬£10, depending current pricing and offers/ vouchers), but they come with 4 mics (2 in each ear piece) and have 40 hour battery life, so quite similar. They both don't really have noise cancelling, and at best have some in call nice reduction for the other party, to help with voice/ video calls, but you don't really expect full blown noise cancelling at this price anyway, you need to be spending about ¬£100+. I honestly find the Aukey ones a better value, as they are cheaper, and functionality and features wise are very similar. I can not really differentiate between the Aukey or Anker ones on sound quality. The only really difference for me is the fact that the Aukey ones turn off the LED from flashing, when in use, so people you are talking to don't get distracted by the flashing light, as they do with the Anker ones. Also quite useful when trying to put little ones to sleep, and flashing LED lights are a big distraction for them Overall great headphones, only 1 star removed as they really don't have noise cancellation, and its a shame they don't support a USB-C charging port, so I only need a single cable for my phone, tablet, laptop and also earphones.

Ok so I bought these ear buds to go with my new phone which does not have a headphone jack. I wanted something small, light and comfortable. These fit the bill because they also come with a small charging case for carrying them around. They are small, light and very comfortable to wear for long periods. I mainly use these when walking the dog or going for a run and have to say the sound quality is excellent. The touch controls on the Earbuds work well too and are a very good addition to the Earbuds. They stay in the ear very well when running and walking and I got wet the other day on a run and they were fine. The charging case is very good and charges the Earbuds as soon as you put them in. Connection to my phone was very simple and took about 20 seconds. Now as soon as I take the Earbuds out of the case they connect to my phone and I'm ready to go, its really that simple. I have to give these Earbuds 5 stars because they work great, the sound quality is excellent and the charging case is brilliant.

Das Preis-Leistungsverh√§ltnis ist einwandfrei kann ich vorab schon einmal sagen. Kommen wir zu den Einzelheiten: Pairing = unkompliziert Verbindung = Einmal gepaired, verbinden sich die KH automatisch mit dem jeweiligen Ger√§t sobald man diese aus der Ladebox nimmt. Beim ersten Mal herausnhemen geht der Kopfh√∂rer in den Pairing Modus. Finden die Kopfh√∂rer das Bluetooth Ger√§t nicht, wechseln sie nach ein paar Sekunden in den Pairing Modus (sinnvoll wenn man BT absichtlich aus hat um ein zweites Ger√§t zu pairen). Ausdauer = bis zu 6 Std. wenn voll geladen Tragekomfort = angenehm, man merkt die Kopfh√∂rer kaum. Verschieden grosse Silikon buds sind zum optimalen Tragen dabei. Bedienung = gut, aber etwas pr√§ziser w√§re toll Verarbeitung = ist ganz ok, Geh√§use der Ladeschale mutet etwas billig an Klang = ist klar und ein wenig basslastig aber recht gut Abschirmung Au√üenger√§usche = sehr gut Gewicht der Kopfh√∂rer = angenehm leicht Powerbank = funktioniert einwandfrei mit verschiedenen Ger√§ten. Mit Statusanzeige aussen an der Ladebox. Leuchtet auf sobald die Kopfh√∂rer und/oder ein externes Ger√§t geladen wird. Gleichzeitiges Laden der Kopfh√∂rer und eines externen Ger√§ts ist kein Problem.

Ich habe dieser Kopfh√∂rer oder EarPods bestellt, weil ich eine nach einer Alternative zu den immer recht gro√üen und sperrigen on Ear Kopfh√∂rern gesucht habe! Was mich nat√ºrlich bei anderen Kopfh√∂rern am meisten gest√∂rt hat, ist das st√§ndig nervende Kabel. Das Gute ist, dass es bei diesen Kopfh√∂rern kein Kabel gibt :) Anbei habe ich ein paar Bilder zu den Pods, damit ihr euch einen kleinen Eindruck verschaffen k√∂nnt. + 3 St√∂psel in unterschiedlichen Gr√∂√üen, (klein, mittel und gro√ü) + Beigelegtes USB Ladekabel + Sehr leicht und angenehm zu tragen + Ladestatus wird in der Box angezeigt + Lassen sich sehr leicht mit dem Smartphone verbinden (wenn man sie einschaltet, dann spricht eine Stimme und gibt einen die Info "Pods ON oder Pods OFF") + Magnetisches Case Ich bin sehr von den Pods angetan und es ist eine echt gute und kosteng√ºnstige Alternative :)

I've wanted wireless earphones that are individual ear pieces for quite some time now, but I couldn't bring myself to splurge ¬£150+ on a pair of AirPods, so I thought I'd take a punt with these. And man, I am so glad I did. Firstly, the sound quality from these things is amazing. Really rich sounds with a great level of bass. I'm hearing sounds and instruments in songs that I've been listening to for ages! When you consider that this is one of the main reasons you buy a pair of headphones, getting this level of quality for ¬£30 is not something I would usually expect. Pairing is incredibly easy. After you do it the first time on your phone/device, it'll always be straightforward. It's as simple as getting the earphones out of their case, and before you can even put them in your ears, they're already ready to go. The case itself is very handy, as it also functions as a power bank. You could probably get a charge/just under for a phone, so I find it's something that would probably be good as an emergency, rather than a dedicated power bank. The case at full charge should be able to provide the earphones with a good level of recharges, if the description is to be believed. Speaking of which, battery life seems good, but I've not been able to fully give it a test yet. I've been listening today for a couple of hours (the longest stretch in the few days I've had them), and my iPhone is still reporting that they're on 100% battery. The fit seems snug, but this will be properly pushed when I take them on a run. But I've worn them on a general walk about and they've felt secure. The box comes with quite a few different bud fits if you need to adapt them for your ears. The gestures on the earphones are pretty simple, with a handy instruction manual telling you what accomplishes what. In practice, they're pretty efficient. I, like most, have accidentally put music on/off as I've been putting them in my ears due to touching them, but this is minor and you learn to stop it after the first few times. It usually registers your touch accurately, but because of how they sit in your ear, you might have to fiddle around with positioning etc. But this is a minor niggle. Overall, this is a fantastic investment. If you need to enter the wireless earphones game but don't want to ball out, then at ¬£30 for these, you can't go wrong. EDIT: so after having used them for a few days, I can confirm that the battery life is give or take what it states, in terms of a single use giving 4-6 hours of use. I did have some issues with the left earphone not performing as optimally in terms of the charge/gestures compared to the right, but I reached out to the seller whose service has been prompt and very helpful.

I‚Äôve had these headphones about a week now and I‚Äôm very impressed with them. I wasn‚Äôt sure what to expect for ¬£20 but I‚Äôve been pleasantly surprised. They came via prime delivery which was great and once I opened them I was once again very happy. They connected to my phones Bluetooth in seconds so I didn‚Äôt have to waste time. The sound is great and they feel light in your ears so they don‚Äôt cause any disruption. I used mine for running and also mountain climbing and they stayed in my ears no problem at all. They come with extra earcups so if the first ones don‚Äôt fit then there is another size to try. When you charge the earphones all you do is plug them into the little docking box which is supplied with them. They will instantly start to charge and it does not take a long time to reach full charge. They also have a good battery life which is great if you are having a day out or maybe running a long distance. I try to review based on quality , look and price and these headphones exceed in all 3 and they won‚Äôt sting your pocket at all. Very happy üòÅüéßüé∂

These are amazing! High quality sound and IPX56 which means they are highly dust proof and waterproof. They have great base and sound is crystal clear. They are very easy to use and easy to pair to your phone. Once paired, they will pair automatically. The connection is very stable with a ten metre range. They are very comfortable to wear and stay in the ears. You can hear your music even in noisy environments. With the built in switch control you are able to control your music and calls. They come with a small magnetic portable charging case which is able to charge the headphones on the go. With the earphones you can get upto four hours of music or talk time on a single charge. You can charge upto five times with the case. No more having to take your charger wire out with you. The charger is very lightweight and small and it will fit in your pocket. Different size eartips are included, to allow you to obtain the perfect fit, plus instructions. The price is excellent for all the features especially being IPX56 rated. Superb value and amazing earphones. I highly recommend this product. If you found this comment helpful please press the button below. Thank you :)

I was looking for a set of budget Bluetooth earphones for travelling and after a search came upon these. All in all, a well made item that doesn't break the bank but offers good value for money.

I didn't know what to expect with this in-ear buds, but I was pleasantly surprised. The box they come in acts as a docking/charging station, which is quite cool. They come with a (short) USB cord and different sized earbuds. I had to charged them initially for about 10 minutes and when they are fully charged the red light will go off. Whilst charging the dock flashes blue. I placed them in my ears, turned Bluetooth on from my phone and the earbuds paired almost instantly with no problems. I have used them for listening to music, taking incoming calls and when at the gym. For the money, they are well worth it !!

Bluetooth headphones with a portable charging dock. It's a concept that I like a lot. Just recharge the black dock which also serves as storage for the headphones and you can carry them everywhere. If you turn on the dock, the headphones turn on and start charging. You can, if you wish, start them manually. The headphones go into the phase of bluetooth display. Regarding the quality of listening, it is very good, there is necessarily better but these listeners will satisfy most people. I was afraid that the headphones fall during a physical activity but finally there are no worries they hold well.

First set of wireless earbuds so I have nothing to compare them to but I'm pleasantly surprised. Amazon seems to be awash with tons of these things, all unbranded so it's hard to know what to choose. If you're a proper soundphile these may not be the best for you, they're very bassy and I had to adjust my phones eq to pull through some of the higher tones but as I listen to "future bass" music this wasn't too much of a concern. Connecting is a little odd as the instruction guide states you can connect just one headphone but you actually need to turn both on for them to connect to the phone as they look for eachother and then the phone once both connected. Better than I expected to be honest

I bought these headphones as a present 4 by nephew. I like that they had a case that charges them up. He said that the headphones are comfortable to wear and the sound quality is very good.. they hold a very good battery life but they do you have a chargeable case so they will always be charged. You can press the button on the earpiece to make the volume go up and down you can pause them and you can skip songs They're nice and little and fit in your ear very comfortably they come with a little material bag that you can put them in so the case doesn't get scratched he's happy so I'm happy happy customer

I usually use the over the head headphones, however wanted some in ear ones. These are great, the noise cancellation quality is perfect and youd expect them to have cost a lot more for the quality. The sound quality is superb. These are great for working out. Not bulky. Basically cant fault.

The earbuds are small enough to not sticking out and looks nice and comfortable to in ear. It comes with comes with interchangeable ear tips which is good if you need a different size of that to get the perfect fitting. I am using the earbuds from last 5-6 days and getting abut 4-5 hours charge time and the case takes very small amount of time to charge the buds which is impressive. These are comfortable to wear and doesn‚Äôt fall off the ear when walking. Thee sound quality is good, maybe not the best but again at that price point I didn‚Äôt expect anything more than this. When you get the right fitting and playing music with moderate level of volume then the noise around almost goes away. It‚Äôs not the best for noise cancelling but does the job decently. Buonasera, rieccoci con l'ennesima coppia di auricolari bluetooth, oramai lo stipendio lo sto spendendo tutto in hi-tech e devo dire che non me ne pento üòÇ a parte questo preambolo gli auricolari ricalcano in toto quelli blasonati della casa della mela per intenderci, ad un prezzo davvero irrisorio. Great little headphones, a fraction of the price of the ‚ÄòAirpods‚Äô. They look so similar too! I bought these because I just couldn‚Äôt chance the expensive Apple ones costing so much not fitting my ears. I have big ears and most ear pods fall out :/ These have so far stayed in and feel really nice. If you are worried about them falling out though they come with little clear rubber cups that fit into the shape of the ear, which I‚Äôm going to use for the gym I‚Äôve decided. I have different earphones for different things like watching TV and listening to audio books, this way they always at some point are charged enough to fully use without worrying I‚Äôll be at the gym monotonously running on the treadmill with no music. I guess you could say I‚Äôm a little OCD lol The charge they hold is fantastic. You can get around 3 and a half hours playing time but the charging case you put them in charges them another 7 times! Giving you around 24 hours continuous play which is great if you are somewhere you can‚Äôt charge them like camping. Although I carry a portable battery charger wherever I go so I‚Äôm always set (my OCD again lol) They can be used to take calls on and skip tracks etc, the usual things you‚Äôd expect. The sound is great for the price, they are a lot more bassy than I expected which, if you‚Äôre anything like me, like things loud! Maybe too loud sometimes, god help me when I‚Äôm older and I‚Äôve ruined my ears lol it‚Äôs worth it though! appreciate music loud while you are young and you still have your faculties about you lol. Anyway I‚Äôm waffling on! Lol Sorry! I‚Äôd happily recommend, especially if you like the sound of bass. If you think my review has helped you in any way could you please click the ‚Äòhelpful‚Äô button below? I‚Äôd really appreciate that. Thank you :)

Con questa recensione vorrei darvi qualche aiutino riguardo al funzonamento di queste cuffie e alla loro installazione. Premessa numero 1: Ho scelto queste cuffiette perch√© le cercavo senza cavo e soprattutto non in-ear, detesto le cuffie in-ear, ed √® quasi impossibile non trovarle cos√¨ oramai. Premessa numero 2: Le tengo connesse al mio Huawei Mate 10. Premessa numero 3: Le uso principalmente per fare le chiamate mentre sono in bicicletta o quando ho il cellulare in carica. La forma della capsula auricolare Yobola ricorda quella della blasonate cuffie Apple, risultano comode sull'orecchio e non sono eccessivamete ingombranti. La confezione risulta ricca, all'interno si trovano le cuffiette, la custodia/caricabatterie, il cavo Micro USB, le istruzioni (in italiano) e due gommini trasparenti utili per modificare la forma della cuffietta e facilitare l'incastro nell'orecchio (ma attenzione! Con questo adattatore le cuffie non entreranno agevolmente nella custodietta). Ci tengo a precisare la procedura di accoppiamento delle cuffiette, nelle istruzioni alcuni passaggi non sono spiegati: prima di collegarle ad un dispositivo bisogna tenere premuti i pulsantini sulle cuffie per almeno 10 secondi, solo cos√¨ si effettuer√† la connessione fra le due. Senza questo procedimento ogni cuffietta trasmetter√† in autonomia un collegamento bluetooth diretto col dispositivo creando incovenienti, problemi di disconnessione, audio sfasato. L'audio √® buono per il prezzo pagato (29 euro durante l'Amazon Day), sono rimasto sorpreso positivamente per la qualit√† delle chiamate e del microfono! Le chiamate funzionano sia con due cuffie che con solo la cuffia sinistra, il rumore di fondo comunque si sente ma non interferisce con la telefonata, in bicicletta purtroppo per√≤ non si possono ottenere risultati soddisfacenti a causa del vento che interisce totalmente con la chiamata. Durante la riproduzioni di video non si nota alcun tipo di ritardo, la connessione risulta stabile e buona. Ogni volta che si vogliono usare bisogna accenderle tramite il tastino, bisogna premerlo per 4 secondi e in cuffia si assister√† alle seguenti fasi: *suono*, voce "Power On", "Pairing", *suono*, "Connected". Insomma..non √® immediato, ci vorranno 10 secondi..ma bisogna sempre ricordarsi e considerare il prezzo pagato! Per spegnere le cuffie basta inserirle nella custodia, si spegneranno in automatico. I pulsanti funzionano solo per mettere in pausa la musica e accettare/rifiutare le chiamate. Le cuffiette non sono incastrate o attaccate magneticamente dentro la custodia, quindi attenzione durante l'apertura. Queste cuffie le definisco funzionali, sono un po' bruttine, non hanno pregi particolari ma funzionano bene. Esteticamente non sono il massimo, anche quel lampeggio blu √® un po' troppo visibile, ma ci si accontenta. Per telefonate e ascolti di musica senza troppe pretese vanno benissimo. Per gli amanti della musica, per gli appassionati di bassi profondi e particolari dettagli meglio lasciare perdere. Insomma...le consiglierei? Se uno non ha pretese assolutamente s√¨ anche considerando il pagato, ovvio! Non si possono paragonare a cuffie da 150/200 euro, tutto ha un prezzo! Recensione aggiornata al 19/07/2019

Per il prezzo a cui vengono prese, e per questo vi consiglio di prenderle in sconto, sono delle ottime cuffie. Non vi aspettare davvero nulla di eccezionale, ma tutto ben equilibrato e funzionale. Unica nota dolente sono davvero delicate, mi sono cadute due o tre volte (magari sono io che ho le mani di pasta frolla) ed una delle due ha avuto una drastica riduzione del volume. Visto che le cercavo abbastanza pi√π "sportive" ho effettuato sul reso per puntare ad altro, ma per circostanze d'ufficio sono delle ottime low cost.

Ho acquistato questi auricolari qualche giorno fa. Punti positivi: Sono comode da indossare. La batteria sembra durare molto, le tre/quattro ore dichiarate sembrano vere. La musica si sente bene. Il volume √® sufficiente, almeno per me che comunque non lo tengo mai molto alto. Nessun lag, ma questo forse perche' ho bluetooth 5 anche nel telefono. Purtroppo non posso comparare con altri auricolari simili. Si possono utilizzare individualmente. La connessione con il telefono avviene molto velocemente e senza intoppi. Ma questo potrebbe anche essere influenzato dal telefono. Io ho un Oneplus 6. Punti negativi: la scatola di ricarica ha un meccanismo di apertura poco pratico in quanto richiede di fare un po troppa forza. Con una mano si apre molto male. Se si applicano i "gommini" in silicone forniti, che dovrebbero migliorare la stabilit√† nell'orecchio, la scatola non si chiude. Comunque io non li uso. Non sono riuscito ad utilizzare gli auricolari per attivare l'assistente di google. Ma qesto potrebbe essere un problema di Android/telefono/coinfigurazione.

These waterproof wireless Bluetooth 5 earbuds come in a great little portable charging case that can also be used as an emergency power bank for phones and other USB powered items. The case contains a 2200mAh battery which can charge each 85mAh earbud a total of 13 times. This will take up to 2.5 hours. A full charge will allow each earbud to be used for between 10 and twelve hours. The buds can also be used singly and you can even share your music by giving one to another person so long as you both stay within the 10m transmission range. The robust feeling case has a nice matt plastic finish, and there is an excellent LED display to show you the overall power level as well as that of each earpiece. Charging is by means of a USB-C type cable and a small one is provided along with differently sized ear tips and an easily understood manual. It is recommended to charge the case at least once every thirty days, and the port is protected by one of the best rubber seals that I have yet come across. As soon as you open the lid, the ear buds automatically pair with each other and this is confirmed by a small beep and by the coloured circles becoming a steady blue. Pairing was very easy. I simply opened the case, went to the Bluetooth section on by phone and selected 'F9' to complete the process in under thirty seconds. As my ears have been working hard for over sixty years, I can only state that I found all the music/sound and monologue files that I tested were very impressive and that the vast majority of background noise was excluded to give a very enjoyable and comfortable listening experience. I can't comment on the other mobile telephone functions as I simply do not make use if them. My only slight difficulty was in removing and replacing the earbuds in the case, but that will come with confidence and practice. All in all, I am delighted with this set.

I am super impressed by this. Firstly it only needs to connect once to my iPhone. Then it was a matter placing my ear and it‚Äôs connected. The battery case is great it can charge your phone if necessary. But rarely use it for that. Mainly it lengthens the battery capacity of the headphones. They can work independently or together. Which is the problem with other one I have tried. The case looks good but the headphones look great. They are responsive to touch when in ear. I‚Äôm impressed and would recommend all day long.

F√ºr den Preis tolle Teile. Am Anfang war ich allerdings kurz davor die Ohrh√∂rer wieder zur√ºck zu senden. So wie hier in wenigen negativen Bewertungen zu lesen, waren sie extrem Basslastig. Tat richtig weh auf die Ohren und ich war erstaunt, wie solch kleine Dinger wummern k√∂nnen. Player auf dem Smartphone war der Mortplayer. Auch mit verschiedenen Equalizer Einstellungen des Players wurde das nicht besser. Durch Zufall startete ungewollt sp√§ter der ebenfalls vorhandene VLC Player. Pl√∂tzlich h√∂rte ich das ganze Gegenteil. Keine B√§sse mehr, daf√ºr hell und blechern. Auch das steht in einigen negativen Bewertungen. Daraufhin probierte ich, neugierig geworden, einige andere Player aus. Und siehe da, der Phonograph Player sorgte f√ºr einen Spitzenklang. Der nutzt allerdings den Android9 eigenen Equalizer und damit kann man den Klang perfekt einstellen. Dazu noch Dolby Atmos aktivieren und staunen. Kein Unterschied zu meinen gewohnten Philips Ohrh√∂rern mehr. Wer also hier Probleme hat sollte ruhig mal mit verschiedenen Playern spielen. Es liegt garantiert nicht an den Ohrh√∂ren. Eher an Player oder Smartphone. Auch die Bluetooth Verbindung ist √§u√üerst stabil, das Pairing geht schnell und zuverl√§ssig. Ich hatte die Teile jetzt zwei Tage √ºber jeweils 8 Stunden in Betrieb und nicht einen Aussetzer der Verbindung und auch kein Stottern der Musik. Auch hier kein Unterschied zu den gewohnten kabelgebundenen H√∂rern. Telefonfunktion ist gut - kann man gut als Freisprechanlage nutzen. Man versteht den Telefonpartner gut und wird auch gut verstanden. Naja, und die Akkus hielten auch satte 11 Stunden durch. Bisher kann ich nichts negatives feststellen. Lernen muss man allerdings die verschiedenen Touchfunktionen. Ich l√∂se zurzeit meist noch das falsche aus.

Me he decantado por estos auriculares y a continuaci√≥n mencionar√© porqu√© tras un mes de usarlos Cosas buenas a mencionar: - El sonido me parece que est√° bastante bien, buenos graves y agudos, aunque si se quiere mejorar a√∫n m√°s existen aplicaciones para ajustarlo. - La duraci√≥n de la bateria del estuche es largu√≠sima, uso los cascos como poco unas 4 horas al d√≠a y con cargar el estuche al m√°ximo una vez puede llegar a durar la bater√≠a m√°s de 3 semanas, algo exagerado, pero incre√≠blemente √∫til y estoy encantado con esto. Sirve para sacarte de un apuro por si no tienes bater√≠a en el movil y necesitas cargarlo, pero no usar√≠a el estuche como bater√≠a externa para el movil. De momento la tapa se abre y se cierra perfectamente as√≠ que no tengo pegas en cuanto a esto. - El sistema de pasar de canci√≥n, pausa, subir y bajar volumen funciona perfectamente, precisamente escog√≠ estos auriculares por esas caracter√≠sticas. No he llegado a hablar con ellos as√≠ que no mencionare nada de eso, tendr√≠a que probarlo. - Algunas personas han comentado que les parecen grandes los auriculares y la caja. La caja de hecho si es bastante grande, abulta si lo llevas en el bolsillo, los auriculares creo que tiene un tama√±o normal. No me parece un inconveniente ya que abulte un poco me da igual. Cosas malas o contras: - Las gomitas o almohadillas que vienen con los auriculares no est√°n bien dise√±adas, no a√≠slan del ruido exterior y al entrar en el o√≠do se siente raro, se nota presi√≥n, no se oye bien el sonido y pueden resbalar, no encajar o salir del oido. Soluci√≥n: he sustituido las almohadillas por otras que si se adaptan perfectamente al o√≠do, no resbalan y son c√≥modas, con √©stas los auriculares mejoran en gran medida y la m√∫sica se oye mucho mejor, lo malo es que est√°s almohadillas puestas en los auriculares no encajan en el agujero del estuche y no cargan, con lo que tengo que sacar las almohadillas al meter los auriculares en el estuche y volver a ponerlas cada vez que vaya a usar los auriculares. En resumen, son unos buenos auriculares, a excepci√≥n de las almohadillas que se soluciona cambiandolas por otras

Auriculares conectividad bluetooth que se recargan autom√°ticamente al guardarlos en su estuche. Lo m√°s destacado y por lo tanto lo que m√°s me ha gustado es: -La inmejorable conectividad de la que dispone gracias a su conexi√≥n bluetooth 5.0 -El estuche sirve para cargar los mismos auriculares incluso debido a su banco de carga tambien permite recargar el movil. -Tiene un sonido de bastante calidad. - Son 100% impermeables siendo usados mientras corr√≠a y no han sufrido ning√∫n defecto -la forma que tienen son bastante c√≥modos. - la autonom√≠a es bastante buena siempre y cuando el volumen sea el adecuado como todo. -Su uso es bastante sencillo -el estuche cargador dispone de una pantalla led que indica la bater√≠a de cada casco y el porcentaje de carga de la bater√≠a que dispone El art√≠culo es bastante bueno para el precio que tiene.

Despues de usarlos a fondo durante tres dias ,dandoles ca√±a y probando todas sus funciones ya puedo decir que son los mejores auriculares inalambricos que e probado.La calidad de sonido es muy buena,los bajos y agudos estan muy equilibrados ofreciendo as√≠ un sonido claro y limpio,la potencia es la leche ya a la mitad se oyen de sobra pero vas subiendo el volumen y al llegar al maximo casi no se puede aguantar de la potencia que tienen sin perder calidad de sonido.Son muy comodos no te das cuenta de que los llevas puestos porque pesan muy poquito.En cuanto a la bateria es increible; despues de usarlos siete horas seguidas sin parar los puse a cargar y aun le quedaban media carga de bateria creo que aproximadamente puedes tener carga para unas 13 o 14 horas sin parar,luego a la hora de cargarlos en una hora mas o menos los tienes cargados.Lo que si me gusta mucho es que la caja de carga tambien es una power bank es decir que puedes cargar el movil usando la carga de la caja.En cuanto a la presentacion es una pasada viene un display digital con la carga que le queda a la caja y con la carga que le queda a cada auricular,le aporta un toque de calidad tremendo.La conexion con el movil es tan sencilla como abrir la caja por primera vez se emparejan los auriculares entre si solos y nada mas que tienes que abrir el bluetooth en tu movil y vincularlo con los auriculares,ya para las siguientes veces que los uses al abrir la caja se vinculan automaticamente.A la hora de cargarlos solamente es quitartelos y meterlos en la caja se iluminaran en azul y empezaran a cargar,cuando esten cargados se iluminaran en verde y se apagan ellos solos.En resumen una compra fantastica si quieres unos auriculares de muy buen sonido, bastante potencia y una muy buena bateria, todo ello por un buen precio.

I was wanting a pair of bluetooth earphones but with so many products available and also being aware of so many fake reviews on Amazon asked my colleagues opinion on his recently purchased ones. Got to say I am glad I did . These are excellent for price set up was easy, sound is immaculate. Charge lasts for ages. When I got them they had 85% charge got to say it took a while to charge them up to full initially probably around 90 minutes but now been using them a week and the charge has not dropped . I would imagine might take them 4-5 hours to charge from low to full but appears will take months before they need charged so I will accept that. Only criticisms is part of the reason I bought them was because I plan on buying a smart watch and wanted earphones to use it when running, they have fallen out a couple of times so personally wouldn't trust them if I was running. An other minus point is they connect immediately to your phones music app when you take them out box so you end up listening to first few bars of the last song you listened to every single time you put them in this gets old very quickly. They are also incredibly sensitive so you try to adjust them to get more comfortable and the sound goes off or another song comes on or it stops the tv show you are watching and starts playing music. Hopefully user error/teething problems though and overall pleased with my buy
