I'm one of the very, very few people who cannot use the apple air pods. No matter how hard I try, they fall out of my ear in less than a minute. I thought I would try a different brand, and when I put these in my ear, they fell out within seconds. I was about to give up, pack up the box, and send it back, but I decided to check out the instruction manual in case i was doing something wrong. I‚Äôm so happy I did. Turns out there were 4 sizes of plastic ear caps included with the earbuds. On my third try, the second smallest ones, I felt how i imagine Cinderella felt when she tried on the glass slipper. They were perfect and no matter how much I jumped up and down or shook my head, they stayed in place! The quality of sound is impeccable, nice highs and lows, with a decent amount of bass. Once I found the right match, the fit was extremely comfortable. I love these headphones, they have already changed my life for the better!

I upgraded from Tozo T8 to the T10 and also own a pair of wireless earbuds from a well known Brand associated with fruit, and have to say I am very impressed with the TOZO T10 in comparison to the other that I own. First of all, They are great value. The set up was very straight forward and connected to my devices bluetooth in a few seconds. When you pick the earbuds up out of the case they automatically attach to each other and have useful light indicators. The case also has light indicators to show the charge level which is very helpful. The waterproof feature is very useful as I'm often worried about headphones if it is raining etc. They fit in my ear nicely and don't fall out as there is a selection of attachment earpiece sizes to best fit the size of your ear. Nice presentation in the box and good clear instructions. The sound is really nice, I have listened to a selection of songs and audiobooks etc and the sound is up there with some of the best sounding earbuds I've used, very clear with good sound range / overall levels and I'd definitely recommend them! The sound range distance is good, I walked downstairs in my home and continued to listen to the headphones no problem (under 10 metres). The case and earbuds feel very premium, there is even a lanyard included for carrying around your neck or hanging on a hook etc. For the price you can't go wrong, also supports wireless charging which I might have to try out as well! I've added an unboxing video plus some photos to help show what's included too. Thanks for reading my review and hopefully this might've helped in your decision to try out these brilliant headphones if you do decide to get these. Happy listening!

I was thoroughly impressed with the Tozo T10. The packaging was incredible, the build quality is top notch, and an amazing set of features for the price even if the price was twice as high. Wireless charging, IPX8 waterproofing, high quality 8mm sound driver, and bluetooth v5.0 are just a few of the high end features the T10's have to offer. Pairing them with my phone was too easy. All you have to do is take them out of the charging case and they are ready for pairing( just a quick note make sure you choose TOZO-T10-R, the right earbud is the primary). The bluetooth v5.0 mean they have a stronger connection and longer distance. I can leave them in my backpack and I am still connected up to 30 feet away. The clarity of the highs and the richness of the bass are of the quality level of the highest end earbuds. I have personally taken these into the shower, I wasn't actually showering at the time, both of the earbuds and the case itself are extremely water resistance. I was pleasantly surprised to find that I could use my T10s for a little over four hours and the charging case is good for four full recharges of the earbuds. Finally, I have to say the Qi wireless chargeable case is very handy. I can set my phone and earbud case on my Qi charging pad and I'm good to go. If you have never used wireless charging, you need to. All in all for the price I could not find a better earbud on the market.

Every Christmas I usually have enough personal money to make an impulse purchase, usually in Electronics. This year, I wanted to upgrade the $20 pair of totally wireless sound (TWS) earbuds I had. They were good, but needed better sound to make them perfect. With a budget of about $100, I started off looking for something good from a known manufacturer (like Samsung, Jabra, etc.) There was just nothing out there in my price range. I couldn't see myself paying that kind of money from a brand I didn't know, so I started looking for a cheaper model. For around $50 I found 3-4 that looked good and reviews were good enough. I liked Anker's other Bluetooth earphones, so the Soundcore Liberty Lites were considered. With the good reviews and previous good ownership of Monoprice products the Monoprice IPX4s were looking good, too. Due diligence and a desire to be able to use one earbud at a time drive me to search Amazon's best rated under $50 TWS sets, and Tozo looked pretty good. While the buds are labeled L and R, they are both the same, and can be put into either ear. They come with 4 tips, and for the first time, I'm not using the largest ones. So if you have really big ear canals and find it hard to get tips that fit, you may find a good fit here. The sound won't knock Bose out of the water, but for the forty dollars I paid, it is good, and an outstanding upgrade from my $20 pair. It has nice bass, and well defined mids and highs. Battery time is right around 4 hours at low volume (I wear them at work as background noise). The travel case can charge one while the other is playing, so I don't find it hard to get through a work day with them. I like the charging case, too. It's well built, and can use a Qi wireless charger, which I don't care about really. There are 4 lights to tell you how charged it is. it closes and fits in a pocket. I can't tell you how many charges it will take, because I usually keep it plugged in. Pairing, once initially done, is easy. Just pull a bud off the charger and it will turn on and start looking for your paired device. Since I'm using one at a time, I find I need to turn the one I'm using off completely first, then get the other one. I paired them first together, and then separate. This is the best part of these for me, almost seamless use. All in all, very happy with the purchase. And I save up some money to get something else. I have already recommended these to people (my brother is not convinced, he has bone conducting headphones he likes). I do like them that much.

Connected these to my fire stick, which is why I purchased it so I can watch tv while my husband is sleeping. The volume on the ToZo was extremely loud. I wasn‚Äôt able to adjust it not even with the tv or fire stick remote. The volume can only be controlled when connected to your phone or tablet. I bought this on Prime Day thinking I was getting a good deal and Paid $49.99 with $3 off but found out other purchase this for around $25/$30. Two stars because they work find when connected to a phone or table but that‚Äôs not what I purchased them for. UPDATE REVIEW... This is an update. TOZO Customer service is wonderful they reached out to me to rectify the issue. They issued another TOZO Bluetooth. The previous one works great with my devices just not with my smart tv. Haven‚Äôt tried the new one yet but Will keep you posted. Thanks TOZO
Great customer care.

I have to say these ear buds are great quality both made and for comfort worked straight out of the box and you can even carge the box with a QI wireless charging pad or through the cable it has different size ear buds for comfort and ive included a small video but if your thinking of buying some then just spend a little bit more and buy these because the sound quality is great

I bought these to take on holiday to Spain, I intended lots of beach and poolside music listening and didn't fancy the wires or bulkiness of my existing headphones. In ear and wire free was a must and having compared many of the headphones on Amazon I ended up choosing these. I wasn't expecting much for the price paid, but first impressions were very positive. The packaging is excellent and suggests premium quality. The charging case is much sturdier than I imagined and the earbuds themselves smaller than I imagined (in a good way). I used the earbuds and charging case daily whilst on holiday for anything from 1-5 hours at a time without any issue. The sound quality is surprisingly very good, a much better bass than I was expecting. Everything seemed nice and clear. I never intended to keep using them daily on my return from holiday, but I have. They are fine when walking too, I expected them to fall out but they don't. I'm not sure I'd trust running in them though. The jury is still out on the long term longevity and battery life a few months down the line, but I'll be happy to revisit this review and update it in a few months if my opinion changes.

So I bought these headphones for a single purpose - use in the hot tub (I already use AirPods for running/exercise and some noise-cancelling Bose headphones for when I'm at work)... I have to admit they were a bit of a shot-in-the-dark and I honestly wasn't expecting much from them, especially as I used to have some cheaper headphones for running that were terrible, and really put me off the 'budget' price point. Now these are clearly not AirPod or Bose standard, but frankly for the price they sound excellent. Crystal clear treble and more than enough low-end for me... using my go to track (Wilderness from Clannad's Anam) they have good definition and far exceeded my expectations. They are much larger than AirPods, and you MUST ensure they are correctly positioned (with the right-sized rubber ends on) or the sound quality drops dramatically - but after a few minutes of getting this right (as a one off) they more than meet the requirements. The size isn't really a hinderance to them, because it lets them sit in the ears quite comfortably - but your mileage might vary (with ear size). I haven't had them long enough to gauge battery life, but the wireless charging feature of the case works fine from my standard charging mat. So the TL;DR... really good value for money and surprisingly high sound quality - Recommend! (For full disclosure they cost ¬£29.99 when I bought them and TOZO have offered me an extra wireless charger, no strings attached - but the later has not influenced my review, other than encouraging me to write it).

This is is my first dabble with Bluetooth Headphones and what a revelation ! First impressions are of a really thought through design of the packaging and storage case which doubles up as a charging dock. it took mys on to point out to me that the box is itself a battery storage and so the buds will charge in your pocket without needing to plug in until the indicators on the box advise the need for recharging. Maybe I was fortunate but the buds (supplied with a range of optional ear socket sizes was already set up correctly for my ears and I was up and running in seconds - The sound quality from both my phone and laptop is fabulous and the buds feel totally secure - I have cycled and jogged with them as well as using around the house. The bluetooth reception distance does require you to be carrying your bluetooth device or to be sitting at your desk - there is not the range to walk into a neighbouring room in the house and maintain connection. i can understand why some reviewers have mentioned using just one earbud - I am impressed at the noise cancelling effect with external noises when wearing these buds. i have not allowed the storage box to fully discharge power so cannot comment about battery life - for my usage, which is maybe an hour at a time, a couple of times a day - the product is ideal !

My partner got me these for valentines day and I have to say they are the best headphones I've had I have used them everyday to listen to music and watch films and programmes.They are so simple to use from opening to using them for first time it was literally minutes the facility to make and receive calls is really good and simple to use too. They fit really well with different size buds provided to suit any ear size which provides comfort . I have to say once I'm wearing them you forget you have them in they are so comfortable. I have to be honest I didn't expect the sound to be as good as it is the sound quality is crisp and clear with the right amount of base to make listening to music really enjoyable. To sum things up I would recommend these ear buds to anyone and I don't think it will be the last product I buy from TOZO. Brill headphones.

This is the 2nd pair of EarPods I've owned. Really quite impressed with these. If like me you figure it's a minefield weighing up all the different alternatives on amazon, then you have my sympathy. None seemed to stand out as clear winners so in the end I guess you just take a chance. These ones seem extremely well made. The case is superb. Sound quality is really good (in my humble opinion!). One of my main requirements was sweatproof so I could wear them whilst training. I cycle indoors on rollers and the sweat just drips off. These are working just a treat. They pair with my iPhone 7+ immediately after taking out of the box. No problem recommending them. Genuinely pleased.

I was a little sceptical about earbuds at first fearing they would be ill fitting, flimsy and with poor sound quality. These items have dispelled my concerns. They are child's play to pair with your phone and deliver very good sound quality. The battery life is superior to the blue tooth earphones I used to use. The carrying box is surprisingly well made and doubles as a charging station. The buds themselves fit neatly in the ear and you are given a variety of sizes to fit your ear size. There is even a voice announcement from the earbuds when you take them out of the carry case telling you that they have been paired correctly.

I'm very impressed with these earbuds. I didn't know what to expect given the mixed reviews and the price but for my purposes they are perfect. Sounds quality is good, better than any other budget Bluetooth headphones, I'm yet to test battery life but impressed by the charging case they sit in when not in use. They are good quality and we'll packaged. If you're after some earbuds but don't want to break the bank give these a shot, you won't be disappointed.

I am very pleased with these earbuds It is worth taking your time getting the right size buds for your ears, but once that is sorted, they are a pleasure to use. I use them when out walking as they are very comfortable and discreet I also you them when exercising on my elliptical which is very vigorous and they are secure and not affected by my sweating Update I looked for some time for a pair of waterproof headphones, and have purchased three other makes. Having used these now for several months I can say they are the best set I have ever had. Comfortable, good sound, unobtrusive and secure. Still highly recommended Further update I read people are saying THPPthese earbuds are not a good fit. In my experience the secret to a good fit is to fit into the ear as instructed, AND THEN ROTATE to secure It is described in the instructions, but not very clearly

je pense que la r√©putation de ce casque n'est plus √† faire(vu les + de 1000 avis *-*).j'utilise ce casque depuis plusieurs mois d√©j√† et j'aimerais faire part de mon exp√©rience aux futurs acheteurs de celui-ci. Connexions 4/5 je trouve la possibilit√© de pouvoir le brancher en Jack tr√®s pratique: quand je suis chez moi,je le branche et quand je suis en d√©placement,j'utilise le Bluetooth. Bluetooth qui est au passage, tr√®s pratique, sur mon ancien casque (un philips √† 60 euros quand meme),il fallait aller dans les r√©glages du Bluetooth √† chaque fois que je voulais l'utiliser. mais sur celui-ci le casque se connecte automatiquement et quasi-instantan√©ment au dernier appareil connect√©, si vous voulez le connecter √† un autre appareil,il vous suffit d'appuyer 2 sec sur le bouton central jusqu'√† ce que vous entendiez une voix dire "Sound one connected".il peut aussi se connecter √† plusieurs appareils Bluetooth en meme temps(votre pc et votre smartphone par exemple) un autre d√©tail qui m'a d√©rang√©, lorsque la batterie du casque commence a etre faible ,cette meme voix m√©canique et assez stridente nous r√©p√©te sans cesse "battery low" alors qu'il reste encore une demi heure d'autonomie au casque ! √† vous donc de choisir, avoir une demie-heure en plus d'autonomie mais devoir endurer cette voix aga√ßante qui r√©p√©te sans cesse "BATTERY LOW" ou avoir une demi heure en moins d'autonomie et avoir l'esprit tranquille. PS: j'avais pr√©vu de noter cette rubrique 4,5/5 mais malheureusement le cable jack du casque s'est cass√© quelques mois plus tard, il ne fonctionnait plus et on entendait une sorte de gr√©sillement en le branchant, je tiens √† pr√©ciser que ce n'est pas dramatique pour un casque √† ce prix la,le cable √©tait offert et vous trouverez facilement,sur le site ou vous etes actuellement,des tas de remplacement pour seulement quelques euros . Autonomie 5/5 L'autonomie du casque quant-√† elle,ne me pose absolument aucun soucis ,en effet, j'utilise le Bluetooth quand je suis en d√©placement ce qui fait que je peux rester plusieurs semaines sans le recharger(et au pire si vous avez peur qu'il vous abandonne,vous pouvez toujours le brancher en filaire et c'est reparti ) Son 4/5 cote son ,je ne suis pas particuli√®rement un expert donc je ne vais pas m'aventurer maladroitement dans des terrains inconnus, je pr√©fere laisser cette tache aux centaines de gens plus comp√©tents que moi,que vous trouverez en scrollant sous mon commentaire. Ce que je peux dire en tant qu'utilisateur lambda c'est que lorsqu une source sonore est jou√©e,on entend une sorte de biiiiip dans le lointain,ce n'est pas d√©rangeant et √ßa ne s'entend que lorsqu'on met le volume tr√®s bas,mais honn√™tement qui √©coute √ßa musique √† 5% du volume sonore‚Ä¶ NOTE FINALE 4/5 pour 35 euros ce casque est un Tr√®s bon rapport qualit√© prix et vous ne trouverez aucun casque √† ce prix la √©tant aussi bon et aussi peu cher en grande surface les seuls b√©mols que je peux en tirer c'est : -les controles √† am√©liorer -l'apparence un peu tape √† l'≈ìil mais c'est subjectif -pas confortable pour certains merci d'avoir lu et j'espere que mon avis vous sera utile (*-*)!

Casque Bluetoot, qui fait bien son travail, la qualit√© du son est super, on entend plus les bruits ext√©rieur, une fois la musique lanc√© ont est vraiment projet√© dans notre musique c'est extra. La bo√Æte contient le c√¢ble USB pour recharger la batteries et d'un prise jack double sens avec un manuel d'utilisations en fran√ßais, anglais, japonais,espagnole et italien. En brefs je suis satisfaite de mon achat, adieux les casque √† files.

j'avais deja achet√© un casque mpow bluetooth il y a 2 ans, il fonctionnait mal, et du coup j'en ai repris un autre. Il faut s'habituer au plastique un peu cheap de la marque, mais sinon les coussins pour les oreilles ont √©t√© aggrandi par rapport au modele precedent, ce qui a accru la qualit√© sonore, sans faire chauffer les oreilles. le casque passe aussi bien sur la TV (samsung) que sur mon ordinateur portable (windows 10) que sur le t√©l√©phone galaxy S7. le casque est leger, et on peut regler la taille parfaitement sur la tete. il se plie ensuite dans une pochette pour gagner en espace de rangement par la suite point a ameliorer durant le parametrage ou lors du demarrage, on entend un bruit "statique" desagr√©able, le son des basses est m√©diocre, de plus, il faudrait un peu ameliorer l'interface de parametrage du casque, car on paire, reinitialise, puis repaire, etc.. on se sais plus ou on en est, surtout si on change d'appareil frequemment comme moi. point a voir par la suite, si la batterie tient sur la dur√©e et si l'arc ne se defait pas a force d'etre pli√© a chaque utilisation

Quand j'ai vu ce casque √† ce prix je n'en attendais pas grand chose. J'ai √©t√© tellement surpris de la qualit√© de ce casque. Il entoure bien toute l'oreille donc c'est tr√®s agr√©able m√™me si on le porte tr√®s longtemps. Et la plus grande des surprise c'est son autonomie !!! Il se recharge en quelques heures (3 ou 4 de m√©moire mais je le laisse une nuit donc je sais pas trop exactement) et ensuite je l'utilise pendant des mois sans le recharger au rythme d'une heure matin et une heure soir les 5 jours de la semaine... Je l'ai recommand√© √† une ami, en rose, elle est ravie aussi. Et si jamais je dois en racheter un √ßa sera celui-l√† sans h√©siter !!!

Tr√®s L√©ger, grosse autonomie, confortable. Je le trouve tr√®s bien, rapport qualit√© prix top. Un son propre. Je l ai achet√© pour √©couter la t√©l√© (film) et √©couter la musique avec mon iPhone, mes casques filaires ne font pas mieux en qualit√©.

J'ai achet√© ce casque un peu en urgence. J'ai des travaux dans mon immeuble et ils sont tellement insupportables, que je ne savais absolument rien entendre, que ce soit PC ou t√©l√©. J'avais trop confiance au produit mais je me suis tromp√© il est tr√®s tr√®s bien bonne son bien pour les tables de mixage il est filaire et Bluetooth en m√™me temps c'est ce que je cherchais merci pour le prix

Recibido en perfectas condiciones y r√°pido. Ich habe mir dieses Headset gekauft, da mich schon l√§nger das Kabel an meinem alten Headset gest√∂rt hat. F√ºr die Lesefaulen: eine Pro und Contra Liste. Weiter unten gibt's das Ganze dann in ausf√ºhrlich :) Pro + Guter Klang + Sehr einfache Einrichtung + Macht f√ºr den Preis einen wertigen Eindruck + Sehr Weich um die Ohren (Langes tragen war kein Problem) + klappbar, daher platzsparend + Reichweite ist gut. Habe 8-10 Meter gemessen. (Kommt auch durch W√§nde ohne Stahlbeton) Contra - Riecht anfangs etwas nach Chemie, verfliegt aber schnell - Habe zuerst ein "Montagsprodukt" erhalten. Der Verk√§ufer hat aber sofort reagiert, war sehr freundlich und hat ein neues zugeschickt, welches funktionierte Beim Auspacken macht das Headset einen wertigen Eindruck. Es war sto√üsicher in Luftpolster-Folie eingewickelt, was ich sehr gut fand, da bei Hartplastikverpackungen sonst immer soviel Plastik verschwendet wird. Das Pairing ist denkbar einfach gewesen. Knopf lange gedr√ºckt halten, das Headset geht an. Nochmal gedr√ºckt halten und das Headset geht in den Pairing Mode. Nur noch am Rechner ausw√§hlen und zack! Funktionierte... nicht lange! Der Kontakt brach nach ein paar Minuten leider immer wieder ab und Audio war nur noch abgehakt zu h√∂ren. Nach kurzem Mail-Verkehr mit dem Verk√§ufer habe ich sofort ein neues zugeschickt bekommen. Bei dem trat der Fehler nicht auf. Produktionsfehler passieren jedem Hersteller. Umso besser fand ich die schnelle Reaktionszeit des Verk√§ufers. Die Audioqualit√§t ist f√ºr den Preis meiner Meinung nach gut. Auch der Tragekomfort ist super. Ich habe es jetzt mehrere Tage jeweils viele Stunden getragen und keine Kopfschmerzen bekommen. Es dr√ºckt nicht und wird auch nicht unangenehm. Einzig der anf√§ngliche Geruch nach Chemie hat mich etwas gest√∂rt. Verflog aber schon nach zwei Tagen. Fazit: Ich bin super zufrieden mit dem Headset und fand die schnelle Reaktionszeit des Verk√§ufers wirklich gut! Wer ein g√ºnstiges Headset mit gutem Klang sucht und dann auch noch auf Service wert legt, dem kann ich dieses Teil hier nur empfehlen.

Bought these as an impulse purchase, but not regretted it. Day they arrived I fully charged them, then gave them a full rigourous test as I went about my daily routine, going to and from work, as well as completing errands, used them for about 3 hours solid. They connected to my phone almost instantly, sound quality is excellent, apart from the odd little jump in the music track, but that is common with any Bluetooth connection, so not really an issue. I was able to wear them the entire time comfortably, no soreness of the ears or discomfort, the buttons on the headphones made it much easier to skip a music track I didn't feel like listening to, as opposed to pulling out my phone every time to click the screen. Even after three hours of continuous use, the battery is still fairly full, so can easily get much more use out of them before they need another charge. All in all, a very good product for what you get, and an absolute steal at their current price!

Fantastic headphones for the money! Pretty colour, comfortable, nice crisp sound. Easy to sync with Bluetooth and very handy feature of answering calls while wearing them, when connected to your phone. Brilliant carry/tidy case with carabinder clip to hook on to bags or jeans. My teenage daughter adores these and rarely has them off now. She is usually a "brands" and "labels" slave so her approval is a compliment. These would make a fantastic gift too although there is no box, just bubble wrap packaging. This is my own, unbiased review and I am not affiliated with the seller or the product in any way.

I got these after being recommended them by a friend and I've been using them for three months now. They arrived on time in the case with an aux cord and instructions. The two major positives are the battery life and Bluetooth. With a full charge and constant usage, these last around 6-8 hours. When I turn them off when I'm not using them, they last the full day. I've had no issues connecting with Bluetooth whatsoever and the range isn't too bad either. I can go into the next room without them disconnecting. The sound quality is also okay for the price. However, here are some major flaws of this product. 1) About two weeks into using this headphones, one of the volume buttons broke. I thought it was my own doing but two of friends who own the exact same pair of headphones had this problem too. 2) The sound leakage is almost amusing. I wasn't expecting to have no sound leakage but someone was able to hear my music and podcasts while they were sitting across from me. The headphones were on my head, over my ears at mid-volume. 3) With the Aux cord, the quality of sound can be very iffy. It was fine on my laptop but with computers and my phone, the sound was distorted and quite echoey. When watching videos, the audio would be sometimes out of sync with the images on screen. 4) Unsurprisingly, the Aux cord broke after 5 days. 5) After a while, the build starts feel a bit flimsy. I have to adjust them now every time when I use them. My sibling got a pair of headphones a few weeks ago. They were suspiciously exactly the same build, shape and size as these headphones. They even have similar Bluetooth names and same "Power off" voice. The only difference was the brand name. She didn't get a case and got hers for ¬£7 less. If the case isn't so much of a necessity, then you can find cheaper alternatives. All in all, these headphones aren't awful but its quality is questionable.

3 months ago I bought these. Only used them about 3 times a week for an hour at a time. Battery does not hold a charge now! Totally useless as a wireless device. If you fully charge them and put them straight on, they go dead within 10 minutes. They also lose the charge when switched off! Totally useless to me now!

Purchased these on Friday night arrived next day which I thought was great, opened the package and my first thoughts were good quality product. Charged them for 4 hours as recommended then connected them to my Samsung s7 with no problems what‚Äôs so ever they connected straight away. Quality of the sound was very good however when the song finishes all you can hear is an annoying bleeping which again goes when the next song starts only to reappear at the end again. Don‚Äôt know if this is a fault on all these headphones or just the way they are but I‚Äôve sent them back for a refund. Giving 3 stars as the service and quality of the product is good but the bleeping drives me to distraction, sorry I really wanted to like these headphones.

I bought a pair of these each for my kids. They love them! They are easy to use, and to connect. For an unbranded product the sounds not bad, even to my husband who's a stickler for sound quality-he laughed at me when I said I'd ordered these, but he was actually quite impressed too. They come with a handy storage case, to protect them form damage in transit, and wires so you can you them the traditional way too, with usable instructions. Overall very impressed!

I love the design of the headphones, I'd been looking at wireless/Bluetooth headphones for a while but the cost was a little high for me. I saw these and thought, "yeah I'll give these a go." Nice comfortable fit over the ears, sound quality is good, design is good, the price was great. I'd buy these again.

Bought for my daily commute to uni and work since I wear a hijab and it pushes down on normal earphones and hurts my ears pretty bad. They are comfortable on my head and works pretty well. I wear it on the biggest length and fits on my head well. Even though the headscarf, I can hear the music pretty loud It comes with a hard storage case which I am actually very grateful for because otherwise I would have had to purchase a separate one. The case is rather bulky in my rucksack but the headphones fit inside well a d protects it which is the important thing. If the case was soft then it might be better. After using my headphones so often, all the letters and symbols have since worn off on the buttons on the side. I think they shouldn't have so many buttons in the first place because even I get confused by them and end up either skipping a song when I want to repeat it, or changing to radio by accident. I also have to charge it every 2 days, which the battery life was a little longer. Still, as a student this is affordable and had lasted me this long that maybe beats wouldn't be able to do, haha!

Really nice Bluetooth headphones. I waited a while to review these to see if they really would last longer than regular head phones... Bought for my 9 year old daughter because I was sick of constantly buying new headphones due to the wire breaking or coming away so we decided to try a Bluetooth set.... They are fab. They are hardy and lightweight. They have a built in fm radio, unfortunately we are not in a good reception area for this, but I imagine if you are this would be such a neat feature. Super easy and simple to control with just a few buttons on the side. A couple of hours to charge to the maximum and they will last my daughter a good few evenings before needing charging again. It also took just seconds to connect and they were good to go. Highly recommended.

It's NOT over the ear as it is sold. So that was a unpreasant surprise when I unpacked it! But that being said, I am a ha[ppy customer after all, because the headphone is comfortable to wear, although on the ear and not over the ear. And it does have a nice sound. I am a bass lover and for the bass is good and teh overal sound is nice for the money. So I am a happy customer after all. I like the soft cover too that comes with it, only I don't like the hook that it has. It does not close properly when not in use or also when in use. But apart from that, I like it. The wire that comes with is also handy when the phone does not have battery life anymore (and that happens often as the battery is not that good...) I am using the headphone for the gym and for that purpose I also use the micro-sd functionality and that works great! Now I don't need to bring my phone to the gym! I would certainly recommend it! Nice sound! 4* because I am happy with it, but it is not "over the ear" as stated in the title, it is ON EAR! (and I don't have big ears)

The headphones fold up neatly and come included with a case, usb charger cable and additional cable for connecting directly into a device. I would‚Äôve preferred longer cables but it‚Äôs not a big deal. The headphones are very comfortable and are padded with soft lining inside. The sound is impressive too, I actually prefer it to my Sony pair which cost over ¬£250! I bought this pair for my son and he absolutely loves them. He really likes the colour too as it matches the kids fire HD Kindle he got for Christmas. The only downside is the charging. It does let you know when the battery is low by sounding a ‚Äúbeep‚Äù in your ear but you have to charge it straight away. They‚Äôre really flimsy at the joints and just snapped, I don‚Äôt like them, luckily I had another pair of cheaper better ones, I can‚Äôt remember what they‚Äôre called but there‚Äôs a pair of Bluetooth headphones that are red and black, Cost maybe ¬£15 on here, qualities the same, and they‚Äôre less flimsy. Purchase (Oct) Charge via USB port. I changed it on Thursday and its still going on moderate use and its now Saturday.... Sunday (Sunday). Buttons are a little fiddly to use and I often press the wrong button when trying to increase /decrease the sound or turn the device on or off. Radio works when it wants to. If syncing to more than one device make sure to turn off items already synced or it won't connect to anything new. Comes in a handy semi hard pouch with a zip. Headphones collapse to enable them to fold. Be careful not to bend at the wrong point as that could break them. A bit flimsy at the best of times but more so when extended. I tend to shorten back and then fold to put away. Comfortable to wear, lightweight. Bought for mother who is still getting to grips with the controls. Nice subtle shade of gold. Update Dec: 07.12.19 Mother doesn't like them. So I'm using them. I've gotten use to the controls now but the radio function remains a mystery to me. Callers or those I call report an irritating echo and poor sound. From my prospective there wasn't much of a problem but I had to revert to turning off the headset to continue the calls. Music sounds relatively good to me, clear but an equaliser would help. When used for my language app it does not pick up, only says the Last word at best. By chance this morning I was listening to music and then put the language app on and it transmitted the full sentences or the words being taught.... Bizarre! Does this mean I have to have my music on in order to hear my language lessons? ü§î Shouldn't be! I have purchased 2 other headphones and the above problems are not there. Yet to use as call receiver or maker. All in the same price bracket.

Firsts of all... the packaging of the product is neat and well thought out, including a small pouch to store your charging pod while you carry your earbuds around. The appearance of the earbuds and charging pod is modern and sleek with a digital display showing the battery life of the pod. Upon first using the earbuds to listen to music my first impression is that they have a very high quality of sound with impressive bass, the earbuds have excellent noise cancellation allowing you to fully experience the full affects of the sound quality. After using for a range of activities including the hands free phone call feature, listening to audiobooks and music the battery life remained well above my expectations and when both pods were placed in the charging pod they both charged back up to 100% within the hour. Overall I would rate these earbuds a 5/5 for sound quality, comfort, ease of use and battery life.

My son wanted AirPods but there were to pricey so I bought these instead after buying a similar pair a couple of weeks ago for my husband. My son is always on the phone to his mates or listening to music from Spotify and I liked these are they are suppose to last 50 hours of music time and 130 hours of battery time - we have not really timed it but I can say they last for ages before needed to be recharged. They have some really neat functions like the LED digital display, smart digital screen which shows the percentage of charge level. It all works via Bluetooth and really easy to set up even a child can do it. Everything you need comes in the box - you get 4 sets of silicone earplugs so have plenty of spares. I hate things with wires as they always seem to tangle up but with these you don‚Äôt need to worry about that, they are also waterproof and the sound quality is fantastic. My son said they are really comfortable and a lot of his friends have asked where they are from.

I‚Äôve bought quite a lot of sets of headphones, earphones etc recently. I have expensive brands and cheaper brands and at 30 odd pound these fall into the cheaper category but that doesn‚Äôt tell the story of these earbuds at all. I bought these nearly a month ago and I‚Äôve already had them taken off me by my brother who loves them. He normally wear beats but tried these and hasn‚Äôt looked back. They came delivered through Amazon Prime too so I got next day delivery as well which is great. First off they come in a case which also charges them when you put them in. Once the earbuds are in the case they automatically switch off charge. The battery life is great too. We always have music on as we both travel for work etc and the battery really does last a good amount of time. As I said I‚Äôve got lots of different headphones etc and some of the cheaper ones don‚Äôt have great volume but these don‚Äôt have that problem at all. The volume is great and they obviously have the benefit of having no wires which is always better in my opinion. They are also so easy to connect to your phone simply find the Bluetooth device and connect it literally takes seconds. I‚Äôd happily use these all of the time they are light and don‚Äôt feel uncomfortable at all. Really good buy and overall based on price, appearance and quality I‚Äôd happily give these top marks.

I got this on a deal for under 30 euros and didn't have much expectations but it blew me away. Sound - The sound is full with enough bass. The bass doesn't feel cheap earphone bass, but rather something full and thick. Connectivity - Very simple and fast. Just take them out of the charging case and they connect automatically. No audio delay on netflix with my Laptop. My laptop only has BT 4.0 and yet these earbuds give you perfectly synced sound. Battery Life - I got it just today and have been watching netflix for 3 hours now on mid-loud audio. Features - The touch controls work flawlessly. Siri works great.

Bought these for the missus to go jogging with as she was tired of wires and she had been stealing MY wireless headphones.....They pair up effortlessly with all our gadgets, phones, tablets, laptops etc. The first time I listened to them I wasn't blown away but then I realised the ear bud was too small for me, I swapped over to a larger profile ear bud ( you get 3 different sizes supplied) and wow what a difference! The clarity of the audio during phone calls is fantastic too. For the price you can't go wrong!

This is the first time I had been sent a product before it was publicly released in order to write a review, so I felt it only right to do a thorough product analysis. Below I have left a pros on cons list with explanations for each point. Pros: Sound - The sound is excellent, no two ways about it, no static, no hum and no muffling. It sounded sharp and clear for music, videos and telephone conversations. Microphone - This headset allows you to do hands free calls with it's built in, internal, microphone. Due to the microphone being inside the right ear drum I was worried that my voice would sound quiet but, according to the person on the other side of the phone, it doesn't sound any different from a normal phone call. Glasses - You'll have no problem wearing glasses while sporting the headset. It doesn't cause any pinching or squeezing. Light-weight - It's surprisingly light. Most wireless headsets have a bit of heft to them but, this one, I can imagine carry around without worrying about getting tired. Durable - With it's size and weight I was worried that it wouldn't be able to survive falling off someone head. So in order to find out I dropped it onto a hardwood floor from about 6 ft, twice, and was pleasantly surprised that not only did it survive but didn't have a mark on it. Cons: Little sound cancelling - It does very little to stop noise from escaping or entering. I found that while playing music the people around me could hear what I was playing if I had my volume at around 50%, I could also hear most things that were going on around me. Size - It's quite small, which can be a good thing, but I found the ear pads weren't able to cover my ears (Which may be while there's little sound cancelling). I had a female friend try them and she found that it was actually a tad too big, causing the pads to hang a bit low on her head. No head padding - Usually you'll find a pad on arch on the headset to add comfort, but not on this headset. I found the hard plastic very uncomfortable. However someone else I had wear the headset didn't mind the lack of pad, so I guess it'll depend on your head shape. Small charging cable - This is a small quibble but the charger that came in the box is remarkable small. It's a standard C charger port so this won't be a problem for most people. Overall it's not perfect, but for the current selling price of ¬£50 I think you'll get more than your monies worth.

Buscaba unos auriculares que pudiese emparejar mediante bluetooth a mi televisor. Finalmente, tras mucho mirar, me decid√≠ a comprar los Sony WH-CH510, y puedo decir que estoy muy satisfecho con la compra: - Est√©ticamente, muy bonitos. No es tan f√°cil encontrar unos auriculares blancos que sean est√©ticos. - Muy, muy ligeros. - Gran autonom√≠a. - S√∫per sencillos de utilizar. - Y de momento, muy c√≥modos. As√≠ que he acertado totalmente con la compra de estos auriculares.

I really can't see how these headphones have such a high rating, they absolutely suck! Granted I only paid ¬£35 for them but still there's tonnes of cheaper headphones that feel miles better. The headphones supposed RRP at ¬£50! They aren't particularly comfortable, don't cover the whole ear so noise cancelling is non existing and the sound quality is poor. As soon as I took them out of the box I knew they were crappy, they look and feel cheap. I've just bought the Tribit over ear headphones for ¬£39.99 and they are 100 times better! Do not buy these headphones!

I have tried a multitude of headphones over the years everything from JVC, Sony, Sennheiser, Philips, WeSC to Grado, Bang & Olufsen and everything in-between. For my money, Grado makes the very best over-ear headphones I have ever bought and they also have exemplary after-sales service. I received these Sony headphones and they are the sixth Sony's I have tested. I have tested the 1000 M3's to a set which retailed over ¬£200 which were designed for Hi Fidelity and now these. From the packaging to the actual product they are nice quality and the sound they produce, given the price, is very good. The big problem in rating headphones and earbuds is that the sound they produce and how they sound is very subjective to review, as two people can listen to a piece of music but they can hear that piece of music differently. In light of this, I am going to try and be as objective about these Earphones as I can. Let us start this review by considering the price, ¬£49.99 at the time of review. This is a good price given the quality of what you are given. They are extremely well made. Everything from the box to the headpiece appears to be top quality., given the low price The headphones themselves are made of quality materials and are quite light. What is not good is that there is no cushioning on the headband. They are not that comfortable to wear over a long period, as I have a large head and need some cushioning. The sound they produce is very good given the price. The reproduction is rich and clear, the bass is fantastic, the middle range is clear and defined and the treble is delightful. The only downside to these phones is the bass, it just lacks a bit of depth. I was not expecting great things from these headphones, yet what they give you in terms of sound quality is very good, given the price. To summarise, these headphones are very well made and produce a sound that is very good. They offer value far beyond the price point. Where they are let down is in the noise-cancelling department. These phones are designed to be used on the go. The amount of background noise is, therefore, going to be loud. This set has no noise-cancelling system and so it kind of defeats the purpose of the set. You have to ask yourself, do you need NC as you journey around? If you don't need it, these are pretty good headphones for the price.

I wanted to wait a few weeks so I could give a fair review. I must say I am impressed with these headphones! To give a bit of background, these are the first set of wireless headphones I have owned. Previous to that I owned a pair of wired Sony headphones, similar to these. I love my music, and really enjoy listening to good quality sound. My initial impressions on the headphones are good. They feel very sturdy and I love how the ear cups twist so that the headphones can be stored flat in my rucksack. Connection to Bluetooth was very quick and easy, and I was able to start listening to Spotify on my phone within 2 minutes! After a full charge overnight, I was intreiged to see how long the headphones would actually last, given the advertised 35 hour battery life! Whilst I haven't kept a diary persay, as a minimum I use the headphones for at least 4 hours a day on my commute to and from work. Each time you turn the headphones on, you have a battery notice played to you, as well as a battery indicator shown on my phone. The headphones lasted for around 7 or 8 days before the headphones advised me to recharge. I haven't run the headphones right down flat, but I would say the 35 hour life is very accurate. These are on ear headphones so it would be unreasonable to expect complete noise cancelling. I wanted a pair of headphones that would not deaden my surroundings completely as I think it's important you aren't completely unaware. However I would say the headphones cancel noise enough to be able to hear the music. I occasionally use the headphones to make and receive telephone calls, both in the office at my desk and whilst commuting. The quality is fantastic, and I've not experienced any problems with the person on the other end not being able to hear me - big thumbs up for this feature! Thinking about the reviews I saw before buying these headphones, I will do my best to remember them and give my own thoughts. - The volume of the headphones are too low, even on the highest setting. I saw a few reviews saying this, both on amazon and a few other sources. I have personally not had any issues with the volume (or lack of) on these headphones. My music taste is varied, and even the softer genres play just fine for me. It may be worth noting that there are two volumes to adjust, your phone and the headphones themselves. Depending on the device you may also be able to adjust the graphic equaliser somewhat if needed. - The headphones are too tight on my head There has only been one occasion where I have experienced a bit of pain on my one ear, however I think they were ill-fitted as I adjusted them on my ears and they were fine thereafter. I would say I have an average sized head! I think you have to bear in mind that these headphones sit on your ears, so they will compress somewhat, so they stay on your head. I would not want them to be looser as I would be conscious they would slide around and potentially fall off my head. Some have suggested that the band itself is uncomfortable, again, I've not had any issues with this regard. All in all I think these are a really great set of headphones for the price. If your a more serious music listener then you may want to consider an alternative option, but I would consider these suitable for most!

Perfect for a low cost Bluetooth headphones, clear sound, NOT nfc so works with my laptop, smartphone & smart TV. Fairly big battery, lasts me 3/4days usage. Bluetooth connection is very good, some dropout when moving around (about 5m from device). Sleek minimalist design, very light too and comfy. Far superior to JVC equivalent.

The ratings I have given reflect the price, about ¬£35. I am very pleased - bought them for listening to podcasts, making calls, and a bit of music. This is actually the second pair, the first had a very unstable bluetooth connection to my Huawei P9. The reference guide cautions against using it near wifi devices but wifi is everywhere now, and I have no problem with my Plantronics earpiece and other devices so I decided the first pair was faulty and sent it back. The replacement arrived the next day and proved me right - the second pair works perfectly. There is no noise cancellation but isolation is quite good, I can't hear my wife talking to me at all when listening to music. They are not the most hifi of headphones but at the price they are perfectly OK - natural, rather than boomy bass and not over bright. Just as well because I have found no way of adjusting anything but the volume on the headphone or the Huawei. Call quality is...good enough [EDIT: after 3 months use I would be less grudging - I have yet to have trouble hearing or being heard]. The first pair had poor microphone gain but I have had no complaints [after many] long calls on this second set. Not quite as precise as the ¬£15 wired Sonys that this item replaces, but I ascribe that to the microphone being further from the mouth. It's just a little bit echoey, and one's own voice is delivered into the earpieces which was a bit odd for a minute or two but I seem to have got used to it now and don't notice. [EDIT: Since I wrote the above, and thanks to the BBC Rutherford & Fry podcast, I now know that this 'feedback' is just the deliberately engineered "sidetone", part of the purpose of which is to prevent people speaking too loudly on calls. I am completely accustomed to the headphones now and I am never aware of it]. I have read that the older CH500, available for a similar price from Amazon, has better call quality and is marginally better for music - but it is not quite as compact, nor does it charge as quickly or last as long - 20 rather than 35 hours per charge. Happy to recommend these. UPDATE. The battery life is indeed good. It typically three or four days, used for 2-3 hours each day, before the "full battery" message at switch on became approximately 70%". I recharged them anyway and continue to do so within a day or two of this alert. One caveat - I have an average sized bonce but I need very little extension on this headset. My wife's head is rather smaller, and in fact it is slightly too big for her at minimum size. If a standard baseball cap is too big for you, probably best look elsewhere.

I thoroughly recommend these phones, especially at the 'Black friday' price of ¬£35. They are an absolute steal

Bought the black version, for WFH, have some support calls. - First issue is the comfort, this is not comfortable at all. The cushion goes on top of your ears and hurts after a while. - The sound is nothing remarkable, noise cancelling is non-existent. Not that I was expecting something different for this price range. Now the real issues: - When having a call, I can hear my voice, the quality of the sound drops and it really makes very hard to understand what is going on. - The real reason I'm making this review is because now I tried with two machines (Windows and Mac) and I realised the device disconnects itself from the bluetooth randomly, is like the headphone restarts itself, disconnects from the bluetooth, tells me the battery and then connects again. This has happened three times in two different machines. Note that once this was IN THE MIDDLE OF A SUPPORT CALL. Hope this goes to the manufacturer.

Aucun des √©couteurs n'as fait mine de partir, le son est tr√®s correct bien que la puissance soit juste ce qu'il faut et l'isolation est l√©g√®re. En rentrant, je constate qu'ils leur restent plus de la moiti√© de la batterie, c'est une belle surprise ! L'autonomie est donc parfaitement plus que suffisante. üìÑBilan : Produit qui correspond largement √† mes attentes, confortables, bon son et tr√®s bonne autonomie.

These are some strange ones. I am hesitating between 4 and 5 stars, and when I started playing with these I initially thought that I'd give them only 3 stars as I immediately noticed a few issues (I have owned some 7-8 pairs of this type of headsets). But after testing them thoroughly and comparing sound quality with my other headsets, I concluded that they have a few superior features, mainly sound quality and comfort, that warrant 5 stars in spite of a few issues. So the sound quality is the best out of all my headsets, including some that are 50% more expensive now. They have a boomy bass (maybe even too boomy), but that can be reduced by slightly moving the earbud backwards (turning it in the ear, if you know what I mean). The higher frequencies are very pleasing and offer good reproduction of the sound. These headphones handled best one song that seemed to overpower other headphones with its loud sounds - these still sounded ok and pleasing. The volume is also quite high, so it's very satisfying. They are also very fast in connecting and disconnecting, however, there is this annoying design issue. When you place them back in the box, they immediately stop playing, but the phone thinks they are still playing and keeps sending them the stream, and they will not switch off until I close the box. This is annoying as an extra step to do. Also, I don't want them to connect to my phone and hijack the audio stream every time and open the box just to look at them - and they are really fast in connecting - only 2 seconds, so it's a world record almost - really fast. If only they did it only when I remove them from the box... Another thing is the cup - the medium size was too small for me, so I needed to use the largest size to enjoy the full sound quality, so someone with large ears has no recourse here. They sit well in the ears and are difficult to shake off with the hooks around the ears, however, to get the best sound quality I can only hook them a little bit - and further twist/turn to put them more behind the ears and all sound quality goes to ... somewhere else. Here are the pros: - great sound quality - great handling of loud sounds - super fast connecting and disconnecting - USB C (finally someone has done it!) - nice looking and soft touch case/box - two colours of ear hooks (I really like the bright green) - very comfortable if fitted properly in the right position - secure fit with comfortable soft hooks - internal volume control by holding the side buttons Cons: - buttons too hard to press (maybe they will wear in and become softer with time) - an annoying feature of switching on upon just opening the box - an annoying feature of not switching off until the box is closed - good sound quality only when hooks are hooked just a little bit over ears, so it's not super secure (but still quite secure - very difficult to shake them off) - the largest cup is actually medium, so most people will need to change and no recurse for people with large ear canals So all in all great sounding headphones with internal volume control and comfortable hooks, but annoying feature of connecting upon opening the box. Some people will be super happy with them while other super annoyed.

Where have these headphones been all my life? - I am a retired musician so i'm very very fussy about my music and how I listen to it, my current pair are quite good quality but the left ear bud keeps falling out no matter how I try to keep it in, I've tried different sizes of the small ear pieces that fit on but to no avail. I was looking to buy a new pair and came across these beauties! - the quality of the playback is exceptional, just enough bass and treble etc, they fit around my ears perfectly so will not keep falling out, even though my wife and I wear glasses they are still very comfortable to wear (See pictures) Very easy to use, simply turn on your bluetooth, look for G4 and you're up and running, couldn't be easier! I'm actually over the moon with these, I listen to virtually everything through headphones, I believe you get the best from your music by doing this so I'm very happy indeed with my purchase, worth every penny in my opinion! 5 Stars all the way! *****

Have yet to take them to the gym (the reason why I purchased them in the first place) but so far this is my impression: Fit - they fit very well with the rubber ear hooks not interfering with my glasses and the default medium size rubber ear-canal caps appear to be a perfect fit, sealing off the outside pretty well (this is the noise cancelation it talks of in the description). Make sure you try all three sizes when you get them because they have a significant effect on sound quality. The key is to make sure they seal the ear canal completely and then the quality really shines. They seem to be comfortable and shouldn't budge even under vigorous exercise to a point where they can be tricky to remove again. They also came with a neon yellow pair of ear hooks too. Sound quality - So far pretty decent, particularly for the price. They are bass heavy without distortion but it can overwhelm the mids however this seems to improved slightly after running them for about 20mins so it might improve once they wear in. They have a solid high end that doesn't sound tinny and overall deliver quite a wide sound stage. Deadmau5 "Some Chords" builds nicely and the bass kick can almost be felt. ELO's Living Thing on the other hand is a little disappointing, lacking sharpness in the drums but the vocals sit nicely and the instrument placement is good. Santana's "oye Como Va" shines, almost sounding like surround sound with the instruments and effects placed around the room. Bluetooth audio codecs appear to be limited to AAC (default) and SBC on my Note 9. Interface - Pretty simple physical rubberized buttons on each that take a fair push to click but work as advertised (single click to pause / play, double click (not overly sensitive how fast you click) to skip with the left ear clicking back and the right ear forward. Holding the button slowly turns the volume up (right ear) and down (left ear). Triple click launches your default voice assistant. Pairing - Easy to set up on my Note 9. Launch the bluetooth setting and hit scan open the lid of the case and wait a few seconds for "G4" to appear then just click pair and that is it. Supports HFP, HSP, A2DP and AVRCP. After use put the headphones back into the case (the snap in place with a satisfying action due to the magnetic restraint holding them in place) and close the lid. The next time just open the lid, and about 2secs later they are paired up and working. The Case itself is small and light with a rubberised texture and USB-C charging port (small cable included).

Love these headphones so much. They look far more expensive than they are. They are a very good quality set. They have the normal earbud sections that fit into your ear canal but also an ear hook that fits around your ears for extra security and grip. They are very very comfortable to wear and come with a spare set of the ear hooks. They really do cancel out the background noise as far as I‚Äôm concerned and are so easy to operate. The sound quality is superb as far as I‚Äôm concerned. They play for about 5hours from a full charge. The case when it‚Äôs fully charged can charge them up just over 4 times. They come with a charging cable as standard. The case is a neat smooth case with a dull finish. Very aesthetically pleasing to the eyes. They put quickly and are definitely ones I‚Äôd recommend. I love them and they don‚Äôt cost the earth.

My wife's reaction when I received them: not another pair!ü§£ü§£ü§£ü§£ I found these very appealing because of the ear hooks and also because of the price. I found alternative earbuds with hooks but they did not look as nice and their box was really prismatic. These have a nice shape and do not take over the whole side of your face. They are still quite discreet. In addition, the shadow of the charging box is just yummy ü§ó. The box does not take long to charge with the USB C cable, plus you can use a fast charger. Most importantly, they are comfortable, secure and the sound is awesome. I went to Chester earlier and on the way back to the car, I listened to some music. The sound was great and I could not hear the sound of buses, cars and vans rushing mere inches off me! The noise isolation is great I love them and just keep getting amazed by how great value technology is nowadays.

I bought these earbuds in one of amazons flashdeals when the comparative HolyHigh earbuds I initially plumped for arrived faulty (only one earbud worked) As such, I can provide a rudimentary comparison between the two brands for those it might be useful to. Frankly, the holyhighs I preferred aesthetically. The charger box seemed a little smaller, the earbuds packed more neatly together, and the earhooks were thicker and appeared less flimsey than these slimmer more flexible ones. I like 'sturdy!'. HOWEVER. The HolyHighs arrived faulty while the Muzili's arrived in perfect condition and bluetoothed to my mobile effortlessly. Initially they sounded a little bass heavy, but going into my mobile music settings and turning to 'reduced bass' (duh!) fixed the worst of the issue and they sound much better for my musical tastes (mostly classical, some pop/classic rock) now. I am not a techie, and was pretty surprised by how much the in-phone EQ settings did change the music, so for anyone not immediately thrilled with the sound, definitely give these settings a looksie before dismissing them. I also initially found the earbuds not especially comfortable and they made my inner ears somewhat 'tickly'. Switching to the smallest spare earbud covers did the trick for me. Noise cancellation is pretty decent. When 'he' listens to his godawful music on the hi-fi I can listen to my earbuds in the same room without hearing any jumble of sound. Which is nice. Its difficult to give an accurate sound comparison against the holyhighs, because of course I only had the one ear to listen through on them, but the sound appeared somewhat comparative. So negligible in my layman opinion as to not be a deciding factor either way. The earbud controls on the Muzili's felt much easier and more responsive than on the holyhighs. Thats handy, particularly for turning on and off on those many occasions when someone ('he' again) interrupts your music just for the sake of making their own voice heard. If the literature is anything to go by these earbuds take the lead in that they offer notably more listening time per charge. I have yet to explore this to its fullest but can confirm that I got 3 days intermittent use from them on a single charge with no signs of needing to charge imminently. Between rooms and floors (one floor) bluetooth does not provide much of an issue (a momentary cut-out of sound occasionally when you close the door between device and earphones but for me it has come back after that temperamental 'blip') but leaving the device inside while you go outside is a complete dealbreaker. I imagine this is common for all bluetooth devices of this budget, but I dont know from actual experience. This isnt a problem for me personally though, since I am never far away from my phone anyway. I'm just bored of getting tangled up in its wires. All in all, a very useful, uber portable little item for housework and blocking out the world. I bought them in a flash deal for around ¬£31. They currently retail on amazon at around ¬£38. I would be happy to pay either price for their functionality and would vote they ultimately trump the currently price comparative holyhighs for the more responsive operation buttons on the earbuds.

I've owned numerous earphones/headphones over the years and consider myself a bit of an audiophile. And while I'm by no means a professional, I'd like to think my experience counts for something. I already own a pair of working bluetooth earphones, but the skip track controls gave up the ghost, which is quite crucial for someone that cycles with their phone in their backpack and thus I felt an upgrade was due, so I bought these. And on first impressions these are actually very good by comparison. They're a bit more expensive than my previous pair, but I feel like the price increase was justified given what I'm getting in return. Out the box, you can tell that they haven't skipped out on materials. While the charge case is made of plastic, it by no means feels like it's going to fall apart the moment you accidentally breathe on it. Battery charge LEDs can be found on the front of the box and a USB Type C socket can be found at the rear, which is a god send if you love standardisation and hate the usual micro USB. The lid is hinged at one end and held in place with magnets at the opposing end, giving it a secure and solid feel when closed. Upon opening the case I was greeted with a very quiet "power on". And honestly I got a lot more excited about that than I should have done. It's a simple but very nice touch , meaning once paired to your phone (which was a pretty easy process), it's literally a case of whipping them out the case and slapping them in your ears without having to faff around with power switches. By contrast my last pair sometimes got possessed and would power off in the on position (they also seem to power off automatically after a few seconds when you put them back in the case). Speaking of slapping them in your ears, they're a very comfortable fit and they certainly don't feel like they're going to fall out. You could probably do a face first front flip over your handlebars, slide along the road for a bit and these things would still be playing graceful orchestral music in your ears throughout the duration... Unlike my last pair which ditched me the minute I left the ground. The buttons for play/pause, skip, etc. are nicely placed and have some nice feedback to them too. Everyone likes a good clicky button and they will satisfy that part of you. One thing to note is that these aren't capacitive touch control. A feature I specifically looked for because capacitive touch control in the rain with wet hands is generally, in my experience, abysmal to work with. Obviously, they come with large and small buds (on top of the preinstalled medium ones) which is to be expected, as well as a fluorescent green hooks in the event you don't like the preinstalled black ones. Again, a nice touch. Sound quality-wise, I honestly don't think you're going to do much better than these for the price range. And while they definitely won't replace my over-ear headphones, they do trump them in that I sadly can't wear my headphones with my bike helmet. I mean... I haven't tried, but I'm not sure I want to give off the cyberpunk teletubby vibe. Moving on, I listen to a lot of 80's rock, hair/glam Metal, the likes of Bon Jovi, Def Leppard, Motley Crue, etc. Because despite being in my early 20's I actually know what good music sounds like. The bass response is great for the form factor and the mid tones are just right for me. The treble is a bit on the sharp side for my personal taste (which is to be expected), but nothing a bit of EQ can't fix. Great sound for the form factor. Overall, I'm pleasantly surprised by these and I imagine you will be too.

+ Lieferumfang - True Wireless-Ohrh√∂rer - Ladecase - Micro-USB-Kabel - Bedienungsanleitung + Soundqualit√§t Das Wichtigste bei jeder Art von Kopfh√∂rern ist nat√ºrlich am Ende des Tages immer ihr Klang. Anhand der Soundqualit√§t k√∂nnte man durchaus meinen, TWS-In-Ears einer der gro√üen, bekannteren und teureren Marken in den Ohren zu haben. + Ausstattung und Verarbeitung Bei der Ladeschale ist es geradezu erstaunlich, wie sie derart kompakt ausfallen konnte und dabei zugleich einen ziemlich gro√üen Akku beinhaltet. Die Bedienung ist sehr einfach und wird gut erkl√§rt. Im Lieferumfang sind verschiedene Aufs√§tze enthalten, so kann man sich die passenden aussuchen und verhindert so ein Druckschmerz im Ohr.

I purchased these for my husband for Christmas they arrived promptly my husband was very impressed with these earbuds the build quality is excellent. They look and feel very durable my husband said that they are very comfortable within the ear and over the back of the ear the sound quality is good very crisp and clear. Setting up was easy the supplied instructions were easy to follow I bought these so he could use his tablet without me having to hear what he is watching. They certainly did the job he has also used them with his phone and he has been very impressed the quality of sound there is no echoing through them. The battery life is good better than other ones we have had in the past so far we have been very impressed with these and based on our experiences we would definitely recommend them.

The MOST comfortable sports Bluetooth earphones I have ever tried so far? Yup! That's right! I truly didn't think that a pair can get so comfortable in your ear until I got those. The first impression I had when I wore them first was "I can barely feel it!" - It is so light and the rubber hook doesn't cause any discomfort around my ears no matter how long I wear them. These are not my first sports pair but surely the best design so far. The earphones come so nicely packed in an elegant box with accessories, USB C cable and a charging base/power bank. Sound quality is really good. The sound is so clear! Also, the Bluetooth connects super fast as soon as the charging base lid. Used it for several hours without needing to charge it at all! Loving this choice and so happy with my purchase!

So I purchased this pair of earphones as I wanted something which was wireless as well as secure around the ear. These Headphones are solid, I‚Äôve been using them for mainly exercise and my commute from home to work and back home again. They last for a long time without having to charge them, the sound quality is good and they stay in your ear when pushing weights and on the treadmill. They look discreet and not too in your face like most Bluetooth headphones. I think one of the nicest features is the box which charges the headphones whilst your on the move. Also it is magnetic and holds the headphones in place. They connect quickly without too much faffing with the Bluetooth setting, very easy to pair with your phone. You can also use just one earphone and you don‚Äôt have to use both of them at the same time. Solid set of headphones! 5 Stars!

There isn't much to dislike about the Muzili Wireless Headphones. I've tried a number of wireless earphones over the last two years on Amazon and these are up at the top. The battery life was the big sell for me- on one charge I'm getting more than 5 hours of play out of them, on android, while running and at the gym, and the short charge time (less than 2 hours) is worth some praise. Comfort is also pretty good- usually the tips on earbuds are the part where things get uncomfortable but these are snug and the overear hooks don't get annoying after long periods of wear, so comfort is great overall. The only minor negative I can find is the lack of bass and while the treble is fantastic and the sound even in voice is great, the bass does lack sometimes on my deeper songs.

Definitely one of the best headphones I have had in the recent past. Headphones are really great. I like the fact that these headphones have all features of basic Bluetooth headphones and in addition to basic features what stands out is the sound quality and its design to ensure they wont falls during the exercise such as running. Its really easy to connect to smartphones and once connected that's it.. It auto connects every time I switched it on while trying it. Sound quality is amazing. Best part is the charging box which stores certain amount of battery power and charges the wireless headphones when I kept them back in to box.Love the design, sound quality and the user friendliness of this headphone. Highly recommended üëç

Every now and again I try to buy a pair of headphones that are most suitable for wearing when running. I was attracted to this set as there are no cables (other than the charging lead) involved. The phones are worn within the ear and hook around the 'shell like' with a rubber leg. I have found them comfortable to wear (having done so for 3 x 5 km runs to date). They do not delve too deeply into the ear canal and have not caused any discomfort either inside or around the outside of my lugs. They are quite light and do not pull down on my ears at all. The decibel level is satisfactory for me, in that it provides a good level of sound while still allowing me to hear surrounding noises, albeit muted. I found these earphone easy to use, to sync with my iPhone, and to charge via the dinky carry/protective casing. All in all, so far, I am happy with my purchase.

Ich bin √ºberrascht √ºber die kleinen Kopfh√∂rer. Diese Kopfh√∂rer lassen sich einfach mit dem Handy koppeln. Der Sound ist satt und gut. Die Aufbewahrungsbox dient gleichzeitig als Alku f√ºr unterwegs. Gro√üer Vorteil, die Ladebuchse ist bereits USB-C. Das Aufladen geht schnell und wird bei geschlossener Box in digitaler Zahl angezeigt.

Ein weiteres cooles Feature ist, dass die Box selbst einen 5V Output hat, sodass man damit im Notfall auch das eigene Handy laden kann. Sehr cool!

Ho acquistato questi auricolari per la mia compagna, dopo avere provato quelli che avevo preso, io anche lei ne vuole un paio tutti suoi, e ho acquistato questo modello perch√© gli piaceva molto esteticamente. Molto semplice il collegamento Bluetooth allo smartphone, √® velocissimo. Audio nella media con prezzi e i modelli che avevo preso io, il volume va abbastanza alto come anche i bassi non sono male, inoltre hanno una buona insonorizzazione dall'esterno. Molto bello anche che si vede sulla base di ricarica la percentuale di ogni auricolare. Sono molto comodi e stabili, e hanno i gommini intercambiabili per varie misure di orecchie. After a long search and spending a lot of money for wireless earbuds I think I finally found earbuds that are comfortable and has a very beautiful sound quality as well. I watched last season of Game of Thrones on my phone with these earbuds and I was blown away by the sound. Bass is incredible. Specially during intense and action packed war scenes. I literally felt like sitting in the theatre because of the amazing sound. Earbuds are incredibly conformable and touch buttons work very well. It takes a little bit of time remember which touch works for which action. I mostly use for pause and play. Phone call quality is really good as well. Well recommended product for the great price.

I like Soundpeats product they give decent sound and this earbud is without exception. I score the earbud down on fitting. Unfortunately I cannot get them secured even after trying various bud sizes and types. Probably more a fault of my unique ears rather than the buds though. I could not use these for the gym or activities as they keep falling out. Sound quality and separation is spot on. UPDATE: after trying to use these ear capsules for a couple of weeks I have revised my score to 1 out of 5. Left earbuds persistently cuts out and lags behind the right bud. Very disappointed as Soundpeats products are usually very good. UPDATE2: earbuds replaced on warranty and all sorted in a couple of days. Excellent warranty service. UPDATE3: Product great, aftercare service great. Now a 5 star product.

Kaufte diese als Ersatz f√ºr andere, die den Geist aufgaben. Einfach, direkt aus der Box zu verwenden. Einfach mit Ihrem Telefon oder iPad zu synchronisieren. Etwas umst√§ndlich raus aus der Ladestation, wenn man wie ich gro√üe Wurstfinger hat. Ich habe aufgeh√§ngt, dass, wenn Sie das Ger√§t auf den Kopf stellen und darunter tippen, ein guter, guter Klang herausspringt. Zum Beispiel, dass Sie sich nicht ein- und ausschalten m√ºssen, wie sie es selbst tun.

Having seen so many apple fans walking arround with white airpods sticking out of each ear, and a fan of the sonic brilliance of a decent pair of 'cans', not to mention my being a clumsy idiot that loses stuff, I was more than a little skeptical about "true wireless" headphone (don't you just love marketing). So come Prime day and a pair of Soundpeats pop up for about ¬£20 my interest peaked and my inner geek was tempted I ordered them, half expecting to be disappointed. And I was... Disappointed I hadn't bought them sooner! Sonically these are not replacing my sennheiser cans, but they are better than many wired in-ear headphones I have owned by far. Battery life is great, easily 4-5hours and the beauty of that recharge case means they are topped up each time you put them away. Genius. Sound quality.... I am using them with an android phone and an app called PowerAmp which I recommend. This app has a really good graphic equiliser function that can be configured individually and saved with profiles for different music types and even headphones via say headphone jack or bluetooth. So while they don't sound bad as they are, I can tailor the sound to suit my taste better using this app and as such if you find yourself not happy with the sound of these or any headphones give that a try. That said they are pretty decent sounding but For pure audio heaven look elsewhere.... On to use... They weigh alsmost nothing, incredibly light so no discomfort at all, the case also very light and easy to carry arround in jeans pocket and is barely noticeable. The touch controls work fine for me, and both earphones will individually annoumce connection. I have not experienced disconnects when the phone is less than 3m away Occasionally at 4m and cut off completely beyond 5-6 but bear in mind this likely has as much to do with your device / phone and what's between it and the headphones, eg walls, 5m and I'm in another room! They are as comfortable as typical in-ear headphones, no noticeable weight at all in fact you do notice the lack of cable drag / snagging that would occasionally yank out and ear bud when moving about which makes them very handy practically (for example - DIY tasks). I don't jog so can't comment on that. These are not noise cancelling to my knowledge but they do a damn good job of noise isolation. As I type this I can not hear a word of what my wife is saying to me :). Now... That are back at full price ¬£30ish would I pay that knowing what I know now... Yes... I would to be honest.

I've had these for a couple of weeks now and am very impressed. I've tried a few others out over the last year without much success and these are by far the best I've used. I'm using them with an iphone SE. The sound you get from them is excellent. I listen to a lot of indie and rock music, from Belle and Sebastian through to the louder stuff like the Foo Fighters and Queens of the Stone Age and the sound you get from them is just as good as the high end earbuds. I use the bass booster equaliser on Spotify and get the right amount of bass I want. Noise reduction is also great. I'm on the u-bahn every day and hardly hear any background noise using the L size rubber things. I also find them really comfortable to wear. They feel a bit loose but aren't. The charger is great and fits into my pocket much better than headphones with cables. My journey to work is about 40 minutes each way so I charge them up on a Sunday and they have power all week and for if I'm out and about on weekends. Overall I'm very happy with them and am so pleased my search for bluetooth headphones is over. My wife tried them out the other day too and has asked me to get her a pair for her birthday in a few weeks.
